<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_1">
</A>Forward-Looking Information </FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">This discussion of our Operational and Financial Review and Prospects contains
forward-looking statements based on beliefs of our management. We use the words &#147;anticipate&#148;, &#147;believe&#148;, &#147;expect&#148;, &#147;may&#148;, &#147;intend&#148;, &#147;should&#148;, &#147;plan&#148;, &#147;project&#148; or
similar expressions to identify forward-looking statements. Such statements reflect our current views with respect to future events and are subject to risks and uncertainties. Many factors could cause the actual results to be materially different,
including, among others, changes in general economic and business conditions, changes in currency exchange rates and interest rates, introduction of competing products, lack of acceptance of new products or services and changes in business strategy.
Such forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, the forecasts and targets included in this discussion under the heading &#147;Operating and Financial Review and Prospects - Overall Perspective&#148;, with respect to (i)&nbsp;our
expectation that the global
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
telecommunications equipment and related services market will have nominal growth, defined as between 0&nbsp;% and 5&nbsp;% in 2010; (ii)&nbsp;our aim to reach an operating profit before
restructuring costs, litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments (excluding the negative, non-cash impacts of Lucent&#146;s purchase price allocation) in the low to mid single digit range
as a percentage of revenue (defined as between 1&nbsp;% and 5&nbsp;% of revenues) in 2010; (iii)&nbsp;statements regarding the expected level of restructuring costs and capital expenditures in 2010, which can be found under the heading
&#147;Liquidity and Capital Resources&#148;; and (iv)&nbsp;statements regarding the amount we would be required to pay in the future pursuant to our existing contractual obligations and off-balance sheet contingent commitments, included in this
discussion under the heading &#147;Contractual obligations and off-balance sheet contingent commitments&#148;. </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>1</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_2">
</A>Presentation of Financial Information </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The following discussion of our financial condition and results
of operations should be read in conjunction with our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements as of and for the six-month period ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 presented elsewhere in this document (the &#147;unaudited condensed
interim consolidated financial statements&#148;) and the related notes. Our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) as adopted
by the European Union. IFRS, as adopted by the European Union, differ in certain respects from the International Financial Reporting Standards issued by the International Accounting Standards Board. However, our unaudited condensed interim
consolidated financial statements presented in accordance with IFRS would be no different if we had applied International Financial Reporting Standards issued by the International Accounting Standards Board. References to &#147;IFRS&#148; in this
Form 6-K refer to IFRS as adopted by the European Union. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Changes
in Accounting Standards as of January&nbsp;1, 2010 </FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>New
financial reporting standards and interpretations that the Group applies but which are not yet mandatory</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As of
June&nbsp;30, 2010, Alcatel-Lucent had not applied any new International Financial Reporting Standards and Interpretations that the European Union has published and adopted but which were not yet mandatory. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>New
financial reporting standards or amendments applied as of January&nbsp;1, 2010</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><B>Business
combinations after January&nbsp;1, 2010</B> <B><I>(IFRS3 revised and IAS 27 amended):</I></B> <I>compared to accounting for business combinations that we completed before January&nbsp;1, 2010, the principal changes are:</I> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For each business combination, the acquirer measures any non-controlling interest in the acquiree either at fair value or at the non-controlling
interest&#146;s proportionate share of the acquiree&#146;s net identifiable assets. Previously, only the latter was permitted; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">the transitional provisions of revised IFRS 3 concerning income taxes could have a
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="37" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
material impact on our future consolidated financial statements, because deferred tax assets recognized for the first time after the end of the business combination&#146;s measurement period will
be recognized in the income statement and no longer adjusted against goodwill, contrary to the accounting treatment prescribed in previous IFRS 3 (see Note&nbsp;1n of the audited consolidated financial statements included in our Annual Report on
Form 20-F for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009 (the &#147;2009 Audited&nbsp;Consolidated&nbsp;Financial&nbsp;Statements&#148;)). In this respect, significant unrecognized income tax loss carry-forwards that relate to Lucent Technologies could
materially impact our consolidated income statement in a positive way, if, in compliance with IAS 12 &#147;Income Taxes&#148;, we are able to recognize deferred tax assets in the future corresponding to these tax losses;
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">the acquirer is no longer permitted to recognize contingencies acquired in a business combination that is not a present obligation of the
acquiree at the date of the business combination; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">costs the acquirer incurs in connection with a business combination must be accounted for separately from the business combination, which usually
means that they are recognized as expenses (rather than included in goodwill); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">consideration transferred by the acquirer, including contingent consideration, is measured and recognized at fair value at the acquisition date.
Subsequent changes in the fair value of contingent consideration classified as liabilities are recognized in accordance with IAS 39, IAS 37 or other IFRSs, as appropriate (rather than by adjusting goodwill); and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">an acquirer must remeasure any equity interest it holds in the acquiree immediately before achieving control at its acquisition-date fair value
and recognize the resulting gain or loss, if any, in profit or loss. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><B><I>Non-controlling
interests after January&nbsp;1, 2010:</I></B> compared to accounting for non-controlling interests before January&nbsp;1, 2010, the principal changes are: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Changes in Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in loss of control are accounted for within equity; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>2</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">when Alcatel-Lucent loses control of a subsidiary, the assets and liabilities and related equity components of the former subsidiary are
derecognized. Any gain or loss is recognized in profit or loss. Any investment retained in the former subsidiary is measured at its fair value at the date when control is lost. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Critical
accounting policies </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Our Operating and Financial Review and Prospects is based on our unaudited condensed
interim consolidated financial statements, which are prepared in accordance with IFRS as described in Note&nbsp;1 to those unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. Some of the accounting methods and policies used in preparing
our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements under IFRS are based on complex and subjective assessments by our management or on estimates based on past experience and assumptions deemed realistic and reasonable based on the
circumstances concerned.
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
The actual value of our assets, liabilities and equity attributable to equity owners of the parent and of our earnings could differ from the value derived from these estimates if conditions
changed and these changes had an impact on the assumptions adopted. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We believe that the accounting methods and
policies listed below are the most likely to be affected by these estimates and assessments: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Valuation
 allowance for inventories and work in progress</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Inventories and work in progress are measured at the
lower of cost or net realizable value. Valuation allowances for inventories and work in progress are calculated based on an analysis of foreseeable changes in demand, technology or the market, in order to determine obsolete or excess inventories and
work in progress. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The valuation allowances are accounted for in cost of sales or in restructuring costs depending on
the nature of the amounts concerned. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Impairment
 of customer receivables</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">An impairment loss is recorded for customer receivables if the expected value
of the future receipts is below the nominal value. The amount of the impairment loss reflects both the customers&#146; ability to honor their debts and the age of the debts in question. A higher default rate than estimated or the deterioration of
our major customers&#146; creditworthiness could have an adverse impact on our future results. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

months&nbsp;ended<BR>June&nbsp;30, 2010</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Year
ended<BR>December 31, 2009</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Impact of impairment losses in income (loss) before income tax and discontinued operations</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">3</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(23)</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>3</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Capitalized
 development costs, other intangible assets and goodwill</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Capitalized development
 costs </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="70%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="13%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="13%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" COLSPAN="3" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(In&nbsp;millions of euros)</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">June&nbsp;
30,&nbsp;2010</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2009
</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Capitalized development costs, net</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">586</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">558</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The criteria for capitalizing development costs are set out in Note&nbsp;1f of the
2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements. Once capitalized, these costs are amortized over the estimated lives of the products concerned (3 to 10 years). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We must therefore evaluate the commercial and technical feasibility of these development projects and estimate the useful lives
of the products resulting from the projects. Should a product fail to substantiate these assumptions, the Group may be required to impair or write off some of the capitalized development costs in the future. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">An impairment loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;3&nbsp;million for capitalized development costs was accounted for in the first six months of 2010
and <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;16&nbsp;million in the first six months of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">During the fourth quarter of 2009, following our decision to cease any new WiMAX development on the existing hardware platform
and software release, restructuring costs of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;44&nbsp;million were reserved.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Other
intangible assets and goodwill </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Goodwill, net</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Intangible assets, net <SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">2,354</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6,937</FONT>
</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6,382</FONT>
</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Including capitalized development costs, net. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Goodwill amounting to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;8,051&nbsp;million and intangible assets amounting to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4,813&nbsp;million were accounted for in 2006 as a result of the Lucent business combination as
described in Note&nbsp;3 of our 2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements, using market-related information, estimates (primarily based on risk adjusted discounted cash flows derived from Lucent&#146;s management) and judgment (in particular in
determining the fair values relating to the intangible assets acquired). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">No impairment loss was accounted for during
the first six months of 2010 and 2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The carrying value of each group of cash generating units at which level
goodwill is monitored for internal management purposes (i.e. Product Division) is compared to its recoverable value. The recoverable value is the higher of the value in use and the fair value less cost to sell. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The value in use of each Product Division is calculated using a five year
discounted cash flow analysis plus a discounted residual value, corresponding to the capitalization to perpetuity of the normalized cash flows of year 5 (Gordon Shapiro approach). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The fair value less cost to sell of each Product Division is determined based upon the weighted average of the Gordon Shapiro
approach described above and the following two approaches: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Five year discounted cash flow analysis plus a Sales Multiple (Enterprise Value-&#148;EV&#148;/Sales) to measure discounted residual value; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">five year discounted cash flow analysis plus an Operating Profit Multiple (Enterprise Value-&#148;EV&#148;/Earnings Before Interest, Tax,
Depreciation and Amortization-&#148;EBITDA&#148;) to measure discounted residual value. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>4</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The recoverable values of our goodwill and intangible assets, as determined for the
impairment tests we performed in the second quarter of 2010, are based on key assumptions which could have a significant impact on the consolidated financial statements. Some of these key assumptions are: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Discount rate; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">a nominal growth (defined as between 0&nbsp;% and 5&nbsp;%) for the telecommunications equipment and related services market in 2010; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>  <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">projected cash-flows which are based on a segment operating income (as defined in Note&nbsp;5) for 2010 and 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The discount rate used for the annual impairment test of 2010 was the Group&#146;s weighted average cost of capital
(&#147;WACC&#148;) of 10&nbsp;%. This discount rate is an after-tax rate applied to after-tax cash flows. The use of such rate results in recoverable values that are identical to those that would be obtained by using, as required by IAS 36, pre-tax
rates applied to pre-tax cash flows. A single discount rate is used on the basis that risks specific to certain products or markets have been reflected in determining the cash flows. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Holding all other assumptions constant, a 0.5&nbsp;% increase or decrease in the discount rate would have decreased or increased
the 2010 recoverable value of goodwill and intangible assets by <I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>792&nbsp;million and
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>894&nbsp;million, respectively. An increase of 0.5&nbsp;% in the discount rate would not
have impacted impairment losses as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In addition to the annual goodwill impairment tests that
occur during the second quarter of each year, impairment tests are carried out if we have indications of a potential reduction in the value of our goodwill or intangible assets. Possible impairments are based on discounted future cash flows and/or
fair values of the assets concerned. Changes in the market conditions or the cash flows initially estimated can therefore lead to a review and a change in the impairment losses previously recorded. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Due to the change in the economic environment and the volatile behaviour of financial markets, we assessed whether as of
March&nbsp;31, 2010 and December&nbsp;31, 2009 there was any indication that any Product Division goodwill may be impaired at that date. We concluded that there were no triggering events that would justify
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
performing an additional impairment test as of March&nbsp;31, 2010 and December&nbsp;31, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Impairment
 of property, plant and equipment</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In accordance with IAS 36 &#147;Impairment of Assets&#148;, when
events or changes in market conditions indicate that tangible or intangible assets may be impaired, such assets are reviewed in detail to determine whether their carrying value is lower than their recoverable value, which could lead to recording an
impairment loss (recoverable value is the higher of value in use and fair value less costs to sell) (see Note&nbsp;1g of the 2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements). Value in use is estimated by calculating the present value of the future
cash flows expected to be derived from the asset. Fair value less costs to sell is based on the most reliable information available (such as market statistics and recent transactions). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">When determining recoverable values of property, plant and equipment, assumptions and estimates are made, based primarily on market
outlooks, obsolescence and sale or liquidation disposal values. Any change in these assumptions can have a significant effect on the recoverable amount and could lead to a revision of recorded impairment losses. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The planned closing of certain facilities, additional reductions in personnel and unfavorable market conditions have been
considered impairment-triggering events in prior years. No impairment loss on property, plant and equipment was accounted for in 2009 or in the six month period ended June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Provision
 for warranty costs and other product sales reserves</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Provisions are recorded for (i)&nbsp;warranties
given to customers on Alcatel-Lucent products, (ii)&nbsp;expected losses at completion and (iii)&nbsp;penalties incurred in the event of failure to meet contractual obligations. These provisions are calculated based on historical return rates and
warranty costs expensed as well as on estimates. These provisions and subsequent changes to the provisions are recorded in the income statement either when revenue is recognized (provision for customer warranties) or, for construction contracts,
when revenue and expenses are recognized by reference to the stage of completion of the contract activity. Costs and penalties ultimately paid can differ considerably from the amounts initially reserved and could therefore have a significant impact
on future results. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>5</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>

 taxes</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Deferred tax assets relate primarily to tax loss carry-forwards and to deductible temporary
differences between reported amounts and the tax bases of assets and liabilities. The assets relating to the tax loss carry-forwards are recognized if it is probable that the Group will generate future taxable profits against which these tax losses
can be set off. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;
&nbsp;</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">836
</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;
&nbsp;</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Following the performance of the 2009 annual goodwill impairment test, a reassessment of deferred taxes resulted in reducing the deferred tax assets recorded in
the United States and increasing those recognized in France compared to the situation as of December&nbsp;31, 2008. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Following the performance of the 2010 annual goodwill impairment test, a reassessment of deferred taxes resulted in increasing deferred tax assets recorded in
France. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Evaluation of our capacity to utilize tax loss carry-forwards relies on significant
judgment. We analyze past events and the positive and negative elements of certain economic factors that may affect its business in the foreseeable future to determine the probability of its future utilization of these tax loss carry-forwards, which
also consider the factors indicated in Note&nbsp;1n of the 2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements. This analysis is carried out regularly in each tax jurisdiction where significant deferred tax assets are recorded. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">If future taxable results are considerably different from those forecast that support recording deferred tax assets, we will be
obliged to revise downwards or upwards the amount of the deferred tax assets, which would have a significant impact on our statement of financial position and net income (loss). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As a result of the business combination with Lucent, <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2,395&nbsp;million of net deferred tax liabilities were recorded as of December&nbsp;31, 2006,
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
resulting from the temporary differences generated by the differences between the fair value of assets and liabilities acquired (mainly intangible assets such as acquired technologies) and their
corresponding tax bases. These deferred tax liabilities will be reduced in the future Group income statements as and when such differences are amortized. The remaining deferred tax liabilities related to the purchase price allocation of Lucent as of
June&nbsp;30, 2010 are <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;819&nbsp;million
(<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;751&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2009). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As prescribed by IFRSs, we had a twelve-month period to complete the purchase price allocation and to determine whether certain
deferred tax assets related to the carry-forward of Lucent&#146;s unused tax losses that had not been recognized in Lucent&#146;s historical financial statements should be recognized in Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s financial statements. If any additional
deferred tax assets attributed to the combined company&#146;s unrecognized tax losses existing as of the transaction date are recognized in future financial statements, the tax benefit will be included in the income statement.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>6</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Pension
and retirement obligations and other employee and post-employment benefit obligations</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Actuarial
 assumptions </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Our results of operations include the impact of significant pension and post-retirement
benefits that are measured using actuarial valuations. Inherent in these valuations are key assumptions, including assumptions about discount rates, expected return
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
on plan assets, healthcare cost trend rates and expected participation rates in retirement healthcare plans. These assumptions are updated on an annual basis at the beginning of each fiscal year
or more frequently upon the occurrence of significant events. In addition, discount rates are updated quarterly for those plans for which changes in these assumptions would have a material impact on our results or equity attributable to equity
owners of the parent. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
