<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #5f46a9; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #5f46a9; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #5f46a9; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Six&nbsp;months&nbsp;ended
<BR>June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2010</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #5f46a9; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1px solid #5f46a9; BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Six&nbsp;months&nbsp;ended
<BR>June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2009</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Weighted average expected rates of return on pension and post-retirement plan assets</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6.55&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6.79&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Weighted average discount rates used to determine the pension and post-retirement obligations</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">5.43&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6.44&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The net effect of pension and post-retirement costs included in &#147;income (loss)
before tax and discontinued operations&#148; was a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;112&nbsp;million increase in pre-tax income
during the first six months of 2010 (<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>150&nbsp;million increase in pre-tax income during 2009
and a <I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>72&nbsp;million decrease in pre-tax income during the first six months 2009). Included
in the <I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>150&nbsp;million increase in 2009 was
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>253&nbsp;million booked as a result of certain changes to management retiree pension and
healthcare benefit plans (refer to Note&nbsp;20 of the unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements at June&nbsp;30, 2010). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Discount
 rates </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Discount rates for our U.S. plans are determined using the values published in the
&#147;original&#148; CitiGroup Pension Discount Curve which is based on AA-rated corporate bonds. Each future year&#146;s expected benefit payments are discounted by the discount rate for the applicable year listed in the CitiGroup Curve, and for
those years beyond the last year presented in the CitiGroup Curve for which we have expected benefit payments, we apply the discount rate of the last year presented in the Curve. After applying the discount rates to all future years&#146; benefits,
we calculate a single discount rate that results in the same interest cost for the next period as the application of the individual rates would have produced. Discount rates for our non U.S. plans are determined based on Bloomberg AA Corporate
yields. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Holding all other assumptions constant, a 0.5&nbsp;% increase or decrease in the discount rate would have
decreased or increased the 2009 net pension and post-retirement result by approximately
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>(35)&nbsp;million and
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>49&nbsp;million, respectively. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Expected return
 on plan assets </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Expected return on plan assets for our U.S. plans are determined based on
recommendations from our external investment advisor and our own experienced historical returns. Our advisor develops its recommendations by applying the long-term return expectations it develops for each of many classes of investments, to the
specific classes and values of investments held by each of our benefit plans. Expected return assumptions are long-term assumptions and are not intended to reflect expectations for the period immediately following their determination. Although these
assumptions are reviewed each year, we do not update them for small changes in our advisor&#146;s recommendations. However, the pension expense or credit for our U.S. plans is updated every quarter using the fair value of assets and discount rates
as of the beginning of the quarter. The expected return on plan assets (accounted for in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148;) for our U.S. plans for second quarter of 2010 is based on March&nbsp;31, 2010 plan asset fair values. However, the
expected return on plan assets for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s non U.S. plans for each quarter of 2010 is based on the fair values of plan assets at December&nbsp;31, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Holding all other assumptions constant, a 0.5&nbsp;% increase or decrease in the expected return on plan assets would have
increased or decreased the 2009 net pension and post-retirement result by approximately
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>122&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For our U.S. plans, we recognized a US$&nbsp;13&nbsp;million increase in the net pension credit between the first and second
quarters of 2010, which is accounted for in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148;. This increase corresponds to a higher expected return on plan assets for our U.S. plans
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>7</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
due to the increase in plan asset fair values and a lower interest cost due to a decrease in discount rates. We expect a US$&nbsp;25&nbsp;million increase in the net pension credit for our U.S.
plans to be accounted for in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; between the second and the third quarters of 2010 for the same reasons. We do not anticipate a material impact outside our U.S. plans. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Healthcare
 inflation trends </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Regarding healthcare inflation trend rates for our U.S. plans, our actuaries annually
review expected cost trends from numerous healthcare providers, recent developments in medical treatments, the utilization of medical services, and Medicare future premium rates published by the U.S. Government&#146;s Center for Medicare and
Medicaid Services (CMS) as these premiums are reimbursed for some retirees. They apply these findings to the specific provisions and experience of our U.S. post-retirement healthcare plans in making their recommendations. In determining our
assumptions, we review our recent experience together with our actuary&#146;s recommendations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Participation
 assumptions </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Our U.S. post-retirement healthcare plans allow participants to opt out of coverage at each
annual enrollment period, and for almost all to opt back in at any future annual enrollment. An assumption is developed for the number of eligible retirees who will elect to participate in our plans at each future enrollment period. Our actuaries
develop a recommendation based on the expected increases in the cost to be paid to a retiree participating in our plans and recent participation history. We review this recommendation annually after the annual enrollment has been completed and
update it if necessary. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Mortality
 assumptions </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The mortality assumption for our U.S. plans is based on actual recent experience of the
participants in our management pension plan and our occupational pension plans. For the 2009 year-end valuation, we updated the mortality assumptions, again based on the actual experience of the two plans. We looked at the experience for the years
of 2004 through 2008. As was the case previously, there was insufficient experience to develop assumptions for active employees and
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
former employees who have delayed commencing their pension benefits, so we used the RP 2000 mortality table projected up to year 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Plan
assets investment </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">At its meeting on July&nbsp;29, 2009, the Board of Directors approved the
following modifications to the asset allocation of&nbsp;our pension funds: the investments in equity&nbsp;securities are to be reduced from&nbsp;22.5&nbsp;% to 15&nbsp;% and the investments in bonds are to be increased from 62.5&nbsp;% to 70&nbsp;%,
while investments in alternatives (i.e., real estate, private equity and hedge funds) are to remain unchanged.&nbsp;The reduction in equity investments in favor of fixed income securities was achieved immediately.&nbsp;The implementation of the
asset allocation approved on July&nbsp;29, 2009 was completed as of January&nbsp;1, 2010. We believe that these changes should lead to a slight decrease in long-term returns from financial assets. The impact of these changes has been reflected in
our expected return assumptions for year 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Plans assets are invested in many different asset categories (such as
cash, equities, bonds, real estate and private equity). In the quarterly update of plan asset fair values, approximately 80&nbsp;% are based on closing date fair values and 20&nbsp;% have a one to three month delay as the fair values of private
equity, venture capital, real estate and absolute return investments are not available in a short period. This is standard practice in the investment management industry. Assuming that the June&nbsp;30, 2010 actual fair values of private equity,
venture capital, real estate and absolute return investments were 10&nbsp;% lower than the ones used for accounting purposes as of June&nbsp;30, 2010, and since the Management Pension Plan has a material investment in these asset classes (the asset
ceiling is not applicable to this plan), equity would be negatively impacted by approximately
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;250&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">2010
US Health Care Legislation </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">On March&nbsp;23, 2010, the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
(PPACA) was signed into law; and on March&nbsp;30, 2010, the Health Care and Education Reconciliation&nbsp;Act of 2010 (HCERA) that amended the PPACA was also signed into law.&nbsp;Under the new legislation, the subsidy paid to us by Medicare for
continuing to provide prescription drug benefits to our U.S. employees and retirees that are at least equivalent to those provided by Medicare Part D, will no longer be tax
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>8</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
free after 2012.&nbsp;This change in law resulted in a&nbsp;write-down of our deferred tax assets which caused a&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;76&nbsp;million charge to the consolidated income statement and a
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;6&nbsp;million profit to the consolidated statement of comprehensive income (refer to Note&nbsp;11
of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements). In addition, reductions in the Medicare payments to Medicare Advantage plans, such as our Private Fee For Service plan which we offer to our U.S. management retirees resulted in
the need to change our related cost assumption, with an increase in our benefit obligation of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;6&nbsp;million recognized in the consolidated statement of comprehensive income as an actuarial
loss (see Note&nbsp;20 of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements).&nbsp;There are several other provisions that may&nbsp;affect our post-retirement health care benefit obligations but for which additional guidance is
needed and expected in order to determine&nbsp;the impact, but we do not expect any impact to be material. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Revenue recognition
</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As indicated in Note&nbsp;1o of the 2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements, revenue under IAS
18 accounting is measured at the fair value of the consideration received or to be received when we have transferred the significant risks and rewards of ownership of a product to the buyer. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For revenues and expenses generated from construction contracts, we apply the percentage of completion method of accounting,
provided certain specified conditions are met, based either on the achievement of contractually defined milestones or on costs incurred compared with total estimated costs. The determination of the stage of completion and the revenues to be
recognized rely on numerous estimations based on costs incurred and acquired experience. Adjustments of initial estimates can, however, occur throughout the life of the contract, which can have significant impacts on future net income (loss).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Although estimates inherent in construction contracts are subject to uncertainty, certain situations exist whereby
management is unable to reliably estimate the outcome of a construction contract. These situations can occur during the early stages of a contract due to a lack of historical experience or throughout the contract as significant uncertainties develop
related to additional costs, claims and performance obligations, particularly with new technologies. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Contracts that are multiple element arrangements can include hardware products,
stand-alone software, installation and/or integration services, extended warranty, product roadmaps, as examples. Revenue for each unit of accounting is recognized when earned based on the relative fair value of each unit of accounting as determined
by internal or third-party analyses of market-based prices. If the criteria described in Note&nbsp;1o of the 2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements are met, revenue is earned when units of accounting are delivered. If such criteria are not
met, revenue for the arrangement as a whole is accounted for as a single unit of accounting. Significant judgment is required to allocate contract consideration to each unit of accounting and determine whether the arrangement is a single unit of
accounting or a multiple element arrangement. Depending upon how such judgment is exercised, the timing and amount of revenue recognized could differ significantly. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For multiple element arrangements that are based principally on licensing, selling or otherwise marketing software solutions,
judgment is required as to whether such arrangements are accounted for under IAS 18 or IAS 11. Software arrangements requiring significant production, modification or customization are accounted for as a construction contract under IAS 11. All other
software arrangements are accounted for under IAS 18, in which case the Group requires vendor specific objective evidence (VSOE) of fair value to separate the multiple software elements. If VSOE of fair value is not available, revenue is deferred
until the final element in the arrangement is delivered or revenue is recognized over the period that services are being performed if services are the last undelivered element. Significant judgment is required to determine the most appropriate
accounting model to be applied in this environment and whether VSOE of fair value exists to allow separation of multiple software elements. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For product sales made through distributors, product returns that are estimated according to contractual obligations and past sales
statistics are recognized as a reduction of sales. Again, if the actual product returns were considerably different from those estimated, the resulting impact on the net income (loss) could be significant. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">It can be difficult to evaluate our capacity to recover receivables. Such evaluation is based on the customers&#146;
creditworthiness and on our capacity to sell such receivables without recourse. If, subsequent to revenue recognition, the
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>9</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
recoverability of a receivable that had been initially considered as likely becomes doubtful, a provision for an impairment loss is then recorded (see Note&nbsp;2b of our unaudited condensed
interim consolidated financial statements). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Purchase
 price allocation of a business combination</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In a business combination, the acquirer must allocate the
cost of the business combination at the acquisition date by recognizing the acquiree&#146;s identifiable assets, liabilities and contingent liabilities at fair value at that date. The allocation is based upon certain valuations and other studies
performed with the assistance of outside valuation specialists. Due to the underlying assumptions made in the valuation process, the determination of those fair values requires estimations of the effects of uncertain future events at the acquisition
date and the carrying amounts of some assets, such as fixed assets, acquired through a business combination could therefore differ significantly in the future. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As prescribed by IFRS 3 (revised), if the initial accounting for a business combination can be determined only provisionally by the
end of the reporting period in which the combination is effected, the acquirer must account for the business combination using those provisional values and has a twelve-month period to complete the purchase price allocation. Any adjustment of the
carrying amount of an identifiable asset or liability made as a result of completing the initial accounting is accounted for as if its fair value at the acquisition date had been recognized from that date. Detailed adjustments accounted for in the
allocation period are disclosed in Note&nbsp;3 of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Once the initial accounting of a business combination is complete, only errors may be corrected. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Accounting
 treatment of convertible bonds with optional redemption periods/dates before contractual maturity</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Some
of our convertible bonds have optional redemption periods/dates occurring before their contractual maturity. All the Alcatel-Lucent convertible bond issues were accounted for in accordance with IAS 32 requirements (paragraphs&nbsp;28 to 32) as
described in Note&nbsp;1m of the 2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements. Classification of the liability and equity
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
components of a convertible instrument is not revised when a change occurs in the likelihood that a conversion will be exercised. On the other hand, if optional redemption periods/dates occur
before the contractual maturity of a debenture, a change in the likelihood of redemption before the contractual maturity can lead to a change in the estimated payments. As prescribed by IAS 39, if an issuer revises the estimates of payment due to
reliable new estimates, it must adjust the carrying amount of the instrument by computing the present value of the remaining cash flows at the original effective interest rate of the financial liability to reflect the revised estimated cash flows.
The adjustment is recognized as income or expense in profit or loss. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As described in Notes&nbsp;9, 17 and 19 of our
unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements, such a change in estimates occurred during the second quarter of 2009 regarding Lucent&#146;s 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debenture. Similar changes in estimates could occur in the
future for all convertible debentures with optional redemption periods/dates. A loss corresponding to the difference between the present value of the revised estimated cash flows and the carrying amount derived from the split accounting, as
described in Note&nbsp;1m of the 2009 Audited Consolidated Financial Statements, could impact &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; as a result of any change in the Group&#146;s estimate of redemption triggers on all of Lucent&#146;s convertible
debt. An approximation of the potential negative impact on &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; is the carrying amount of the equity component, as disclosed in Notes&nbsp;17 and 19 of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial
statements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Because of the new accounting treatment described above, the carrying amount of the Lucent 2.875&nbsp;%
Series A convertible debentures was equal to the nominal value of the debentures just before the first optional redemption date (that is, June&nbsp;15, 2010). Some of the holders of the Series A convertible debentures did not request redemptions as
of June&nbsp;15, 2010. At June&nbsp;30, 2010, and as described in Notes&nbsp;9, 17 and 19 of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements, we did not consider it possible to estimate reliably the future cash flows and the
expected life of the remaining outstanding debentures, because the next optional redemption date (that is, June&nbsp;15, 2015) is too far in the future. Thus, and as prescribed by IAS 39, we reapplied the initial accounting treatment and adjusted
the carrying amount of the outstanding Series A convertible debentures using their contractual cash </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>10</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
flows up to their contractual maturity date (that is, June&nbsp;15, 2023). A profit corresponding to the difference between the outstanding nominal value and the present value of the cash flows
up to the contractual maturity date was recognized in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148;. Further changes in estimates in respect of the Series A convertible debentures may occur in the future, in which case the carrying amount of the
debentures could be further adjusted. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Insured damages
</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In 2008, we experienced a fire in a newly-built factory containing new machinery. Non-recoverable
assets having a net book value of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4&nbsp;million were written off as of September&nbsp;30, 2008,
representing an equivalent negative impact on cost of sales in 2008. The cost of the physical damage and business interruption were insured and gave right to an indemnity claim, the amount of which was definitively settled as of September&nbsp;30,
2009. Alcatel-Lucent received <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;33&nbsp;million on its business interruption insurance which was
accounted for in other revenues during 2009, when the cash was received. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In December&nbsp;2009, the roof and technical floor of Alcatel-Lucent Spain&#146;s
headquarters in Madrid partially collapsed for unknown reasons. Alcatel-Lucent Spain rents this building and the lease is accounted for as an operating lease. The damaged assets were derecognized as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 with a negative impact
of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million on income (loss) from operating activities. All costs related to this incident
(damaged assets, displacement and relocation costs, etc.) are insured subject to a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;15&nbsp;million
deductible. Displacement and relocation costs below this threshold will be accounted for as incurred in 2010. These costs represented a negative impact of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million on income (loss) from operating activities during the first six months of 2010. As
the cause of the incident is still not known, nothing has been reserved related to Alcatel-Lucent Spain&#146;s potential liability to third parties. At this stage, Alcatel-Lucent Spain&#146;s liability is not considered probable. However, depending
upon the results of the investigation, this situation could evolve. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>11</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="6" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="6"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="6" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_3">
</A><U>1. OPERATING AND FINANCIAL REVIEW AND PROSPECTS</U> </FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_4">
</A>1.1 O<SMALL>VERALL</SMALL> P<SMALL>ERSPECTIVE</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Overview of the first half of 2010.</I> The global economy started to recover
from the 2008-2009 recession in the first half of 2010, but with significant regional differences in the strength of the recovery. The turnaround has been most apparent in the U.S. and in China, India and some other emerging economies but lagging
elsewhere, particularly in Europe. Overall, the pace of the recovery has been slow by historic standards, with only limited improvement in employment, housing and the availability of credit. Concerns about the future of this relatively fragile
recovery have been heightened by the sovereign debt crisis in Europe, the potential end of expansive fiscal policies, and continued financial instability. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In addition to the short-term challenges posed by the economic cycle, service providers and vendors of telecommunications
equipment and related services are also dealing with longer-term, industry-specific trends that are fundamentally re-shaping their business: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Increased penetration of smartphones is driving explosive growth in mobile data traffic, challenging operators to maintain quality of service and
to profitably accommodate surging traffic volumes; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">operators are transforming their networks to an all-IP architecture; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">the number of new communications users is increasing, particularly in emerging markets where the demand for low-cost network solutions has
facilitated significant market share gains by Chinese suppliers. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As these developments unfolded
over the first half of 2010, it became apparent that the recovery in the global economy was helping to drive a recovery in the market for telecommunications equipment and related services. Like the recovery in the economy, the turnaround in this
market has been somewhat limited, particularly in terms of its geographic and technology scope. It has also been constrained by shortages of electronic components.
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
From a technology perspective, the recovery has been focused around wireless and the key wireline technologies, such as IP (Internet protocol) and terrestrial optics, which are critical to
carrier efforts to profitably accommodate surging traffic volumes. Elsewhere, the recovery has provided little relief for market segments dominated by legacy technologies (second-generation wireless, legacy switching and copper-based broadband
access), which remain the focus of cutbacks in carrier spending. Geographically, the recovery in this market has been led by North America, with more sluggish gains in other regions reflecting economic conditions and some country-specific issues. In
China, for example, growth in the market for wireless equipment is down sharply this year because carriers completed the first stage of their deployment of third-generation networks last year. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Our own business generally reflected these broad trends in the first half of 2010. A decline in our Networks business was partly
attributable to a shortage of components, especially in our wireless and terrestrial optics supply chains. Even so, our 3G W-CDMA wireless business increased at a double-digit rate, driven by gains in North America, and our 3G CDMA wireless business
also benefitted from increased carrier spending to accommodate the strong growth in mobile data traffic. Our IP service router business increased at a double-digit rate in the first half of 2010, with growth in mobile data traffic driving
particularly strong gains in the mobile backhaul segment. Our optics business benefitted from carrier spending to add capacity and was particularly strong in North America. Meanwhile, our legacy businesses, including 2G wireless, core switching and
traditional ADSL-based broadband access, declined. Elsewhere in our portfolio, activity in our Services and Applications groups held up better than our Networks business. Regionally, our business increased in North America but declined in Europe,
Asia-Pacific and the Rest of World. Our China business was particularly weak. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Outlook for full year 2010.
</I>While our supply chain is still experiencing capacity constraints, the demand for telecommunications equipment and </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>12</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
related services is recovering due to booming data traffic and the need to increase network efficiency. Therefore: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For 2010 Alcatel-Lucent continues to expect nominal growth (defined as between 0&nbsp;% and 5&nbsp;%) for the telecommunications equipment and
related services market; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">for 2010, Alcatel-Lucent aims to reach an operating profit before restructuring costs, litigations, gain/loss on disposal of consolidated
entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments (excluding the negative non-cash impacts of Lucent&#146;s purchase price allocation) in the low to mid single-digit range (defined as between 1&nbsp;% and 5&nbsp;%) as a percentage of revenue.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_5">
</A>1.2 H<SMALL>IGHLIGHTS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>RECENT</SMALL> <SMALL>EVENTS</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Sale of 2Wire stake.</I> On July&nbsp;25, 2010, we, as the holder of
approximately 22&nbsp;% of the stock (on a fully-diluted basis) of 2Wire, a U.S.-based provider of advanced residential gateways for the broadband service provider market, together with other stockholders of 2Wire, Pace, a U.K.-based technology
developer for the global pay TV market, and 2Wire executed an agreement for the sale of 2Wire to Pace for a total consideration of US$&nbsp;475&nbsp;million. The closing of this transaction,
</FONT></P> </DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
which is subject to regulatory approvals and other customary terms and conditions, is expected to take place in the fourth quarter of 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Bond issuance. </I>In July&nbsp;2010, we issued a series of notes for an aggregate
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;100&nbsp;million in nominal value. The notes bear interest at a floating rate and are due in 2011,
with the right to extend the maturity at our option to 2016. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_6">
</A>1.3 H<SMALL>IGHLIGHTS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>TRANSACTIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>DURING</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>SIX</SMALL> <SMALL>MONTHS</SMALL> <SMALL>ENDED</SMALL> J<SMALL>UNE</SMALL>&nbsp;30, 2010 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Developments in Microsoft cases</I>. On February&nbsp;22, 2010, Microsoft
filed a Petition for a Writ of Certiorari in the United States Supreme Court asking the Supreme Court to review the Federal Circuit&#146;s September&nbsp;11, 2009 decision to affirm the District Court&#146;s June&nbsp;19, 2008 finding that
Microsoft&#146;s Outlook, Money and Windows Mobile products infringed the Day patent owned by us. On April&nbsp;23, 2010, we filed our Brief in Opposition and the Supreme Court denied Microsoft&#146;s Petition on May&nbsp;24, 2010. A trial is
scheduled for December&nbsp;3, 2010 in U.S. District Court in San Diego to determine the amount of compensation owed to us by Microsoft for its infringement of the Day patent. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">On March&nbsp;2, 2010, the United States Patent and Trademark Office issued a Reexamination Certificate confirming the validity
of the Day patent in response to the reexamination request filed by Dell in May of 2007. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>No 2009 dividend.</I> Our Board determined that it was not prudent to pay a
dividend on our ordinary shares and ADSs based on 2009 results. This proposal was presented by our Board and approved at our Shareholders&#146; Meeting on June&nbsp;1, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Repurchases and partial redemption of convertible bonds.</I> In February and March&nbsp;2010, some of the Lucent 2.875&nbsp;%
U.S.$&nbsp;Series A convertible bonds due June&nbsp;2023 were repurchased and cancelled using US$&nbsp;74.8&nbsp;million in cash excluding accrued interest, corresponding to a nominal value of US$&nbsp;75.0&nbsp;million. Further, on June&nbsp;15,
2010, most of the remaining holders of the Lucent Series A bonds exercised their optional redemption right, and as a result we paid the redeeming holders US$&nbsp;360&nbsp;million in cash excluding accrued interest, corresponding to the nominal
value of the bonds redeemed. </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>13</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_7">
</A>1.4 H<SMALL>IGHLIGHTS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>TRANSACTIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>DURING</SMALL> 2009 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">Joint
ventures and dispositions </FONT></B></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Joint venture with Bharti Airtel</I>. On April&nbsp;30, 2009, we
announced the formation of a joint venture with Bharti Airtel to manage Bharti Airtel&#146;s pan-India broadband and telephone services and help Airtel&#146;s transition to a next generation network across India. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Thales</I>. In May&nbsp;2009, we completed the sale of our 20.8&nbsp;% stake in Thales to Dassault Aviation for
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1.566&nbsp;billion. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Disposal of the space businesses to Thales - earn out</I>. The purchase price of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;670&nbsp;million paid to the Group by Thales for the disposal of the space business completed in
2007 was subject to adjustment in 2009. As a result, Thales was required to pay the Group an additional
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;130&nbsp;million (before fees) accounted for in &#147;income from discontinued operations&#148;, of
which <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;118&nbsp;million was actually paid during the second quarter of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Electrical motors. </I>On December&nbsp;31, 2009, we completed the sale of Dunkermotoren GmbH, our electrical fractional
horsepower motors and drives subsidiary, to Triton, a leading European private equity firm, for an enterprise value of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;145&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">Other
matters </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Co-sourcing and joint marketing arrangement with Hewlett-Packard (HP).</I> On June&nbsp;18,
2009, we and HP jointly announced a 10-year co-sourcing agreement which is expected to help improve the efficiency of our IS/IT (Information Systems/Information Technology) infrastructure and create a joint go-to-market approach. Under the joint
marketing agreement, the two companies will be able to jointly and separately deliver integrated IT and telecom products and services to service providers and mid- to large-size enterprise customers. Definitive agreements were signed on
October&nbsp;20, 2009, and were implemented beginning December&nbsp;2009. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Changes in credit rating.</I> On
November&nbsp;9, 2009, Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s lowered to &#147;B&#148; from &#147;B+&#148; its long-term corporate credit ratings and senior
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
unsecured ratings on Alcatel-Lucent and on Alcatel-Lucent USA Inc. The &#147;B&#148; short-term credit ratings of Alcatel-Lucent was affirmed. The rating on the trust preferred securities of
Lucent Technologies Capital Trust I was lowered from &#147;CCC+&#148; to &#147;CCC&#148;. The negative outlook was maintained. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">On February&nbsp;18, 2009, Moody&#146;s lowered the Alcatel-Lucent Corporate Family Rating as well as the rating for senior debt
of the Group from Ba3 to B1. The trust preferred securities of Lucent Technologies Capital Trust I were downgraded from B2 to B3. The Not-Prime rating for the Group&#146;s short-term debt was confirmed. The negative outlook was maintained.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Issuance and repurchases of convertible bonds.</I> On September&nbsp;2, 2009, we launched a convertible bond
offering. The bonds are convertible into and/or exchangeable for new or existing shares of Alcatel-Lucent (we refer to these convertible bonds as Oceane). The bonds carry a 5&nbsp;% annual interest rate and the initial conversion price is
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;3.23, equivalent to a conversion premium of 35&nbsp;%. They are redeemable in cash, at par, on
January&nbsp;1, 2015. Early redemption at our option is possible under certain conditions. On settlement date (September&nbsp;10, 2009), the proceeds of this offering, including the over-allotment option, were approximately
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;billion. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Concurrently, we offered to repurchase and cancel some of our existing convertible bonds due 2011. On settlement date for the
repurchase (September&nbsp;11, 2009), we purchased 11.97&nbsp;% of the outstanding 2011 bonds. The price per bond was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;16.70 (including accrued interest) and the total amount paid was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;126&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Repurchases of the 2011 bonds also took place after the closing of the repurchase offer. Overall, in 2009, we repurchased bonds
of a nominal value of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;204&nbsp;million, corresponding to 19.98&nbsp;% of the outstanding 2011
bonds, for a total cash amount paid of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;204&nbsp;million, excluding accrued interest. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We also partially repurchased and cancelled outstanding Lucent 7.75&nbsp;% U.S.$&nbsp;convertible bonds due March&nbsp;2017 in
2009, using a total cash amount of US$&nbsp;28&nbsp;million, corresponding to a nominal value of US$&nbsp;99&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We partially repurchased and cancelled outstanding Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% U.S.$&nbsp;Series A
</FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>14</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
convertible bonds due June&nbsp;2023 in 2009, using US$&nbsp;218&nbsp;million in cash excluding accrued interest, corresponding to a nominal value of US$&nbsp;220&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Developments in Microsoft cases.</I> On May&nbsp;13, 2009, we and Dell agreed to a settlement and dismissal of certain issues
appealed after a trial involving us, Dell and Microsoft, held in April 2008. Thereafter, the only matter that remained pending was the appeal filed by Microsoft with the Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit in Washington, D.C. relating to the
&#147;Day&#148; Patent, which relates to a computerized form entry system. On June&nbsp;19, 2008, the District Court had entered a judgement based on a jury award to us of approximately US$&nbsp;357&nbsp;million in damages for Microsoft&#146;s
infringement of the Day Patent in the April&nbsp;2008 trial, and had also awarded us prejudgement interest exceeding US$&nbsp;140&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Oral argument before the Federal Circuit was held on June&nbsp;2, 2009, and on September&nbsp;11, 2009, the Federal Circuit
issued its opinion affirming that the Day Patent is both a valid patent and infringed by Microsoft in Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Money, and Windows Mobile products. However, the Federal Circuit vacated the jury&#146;s damages award and ordered a
new trial in the District Court in San Diego to re-calculate the amount of damages owed to us for Microsoft&#146;s infringement. On November&nbsp;23, 2009, the Federal Circuit denied Microsoft&#146;s &#147;en banc&#148; petition for a rehearing on
the validity of the Day Patent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In a parallel proceeding, Dell filed a reexamination of the Day Patent with the
United States Patent and Trademark Office (&#147;Patent
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
Office&#148;), in May&nbsp;2007, alleging that prior art existed that was not previously considered in the original examination and the Day patent should therefore be re-examined for
patentability. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>FCPA investigations</I>. In December&nbsp;2009 we reached agreements in principle with the SEC
and the U.S. Department of Justice with regard to the settlement of their ongoing investigations involving our alleged violations of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) in several countries, including Costa Rica, Taiwan, and Kenya. Under the
agreement in principle with the SEC, we would enter into a consent decree under which we would neither admit nor deny violations of the antibribery, internal controls and books and records provisions of the FCPA and would be enjoined from future
violations of U.S. securities laws, pay US$&nbsp;45.4&nbsp;million in disgorgement of profits and prejudgment interest and agree to a three-year French anticorruption compliance monitor. Under the agreement in principle with the DOJ, we would enter
into a three-year deferred prosecution agreement (DPA), charging us with violations of the internal controls and books and records provisions of the FCPA, and we would pay a total criminal fine of US$&nbsp;92&nbsp;million, payable in four
installments over the course of three years. In addition, three of our subsidiaries - Alcatel-Lucent France, Alcatel-Lucent Trade International AG and Alcatel Centroamerica - would each plead guilty to violations of the FCPA&#146;s antibribery,
books and records and internal accounting controls provisions. If we fully comply with the terms of the DPA, the DOJ would dismiss the charges upon conclusion of the three-year term. Final agreements must still be reached with these agencies and
accepted in court. </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_8">
</A>1.5 C<SMALL>ONSOLIDATED</SMALL> R<SMALL>ESULTS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> O<SMALL>PERATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> S<SMALL>IX</SMALL> M<SMALL>ONTHS</SMALL> E<SMALL>NDED</SMALL> J<SMALL>UNE</SMALL>&nbsp;30, 2010
C<SMALL>OMPARED</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> S<SMALL>IX</SMALL> M<SMALL>ONTHS</SMALL> <SMALL>ENDED</SMALL> J<SMALL>UNE</SMALL>&nbsp;30, 2009 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Revenues.</I> Revenues totaled
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;7,060&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, a decline of 5.9&nbsp;% from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;7,503&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009. Approximately 55&nbsp;% of our revenues are
denominated in or linked to the U.S. dollar. When we translate these sales into euros for accounting purposes, there is an exchange rate impact based on the relative value of the euro versus other currencies, including the U.S. dollar. The decline
in the value of the euro relative to other currencies in </FONT></P>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
the first half of 2010 compared with the first half of 2009 has tempered the decline in our reported revenues. If there had been constant exchange rates in the first half of 2010 as compared to
the first half of 2009, our consolidated revenues would have declined by approximately 7.9&nbsp;% instead of the 5.9&nbsp;% decrease actually reported. This is based on applying (i)&nbsp;to our sales made directly in currencies other than the euro
effected during the first half of 2010, the average exchange rate that </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>15</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
applied for the same period in 2009, instead of the average exchange rate that applied for the first half of 2010, and (ii)&nbsp;to our exports (mainly from Europe) effected during the first half
of 2010 which are denominated in other currencies and for </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">which we enter into hedging transactions, our
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
average hedging rates that applied for the same period in 2009. Our management believes that providing our investors with our revenues for the first half of 2010 at a constant exchange rate
facilitates the comparison of the evolution of our revenues with that of the industry. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The table below
sets forth our revenues as reported, the conversion and hedging impact of the euro/U.S. dollar and our revenues at a constant rate: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Conversion impact euro/other currencies</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Hedging impact euro/other currencies</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(10)</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Revenues at constant rate</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6,908</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">7,503</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;7.9&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues in our Networks segment fell 8.1&nbsp;% in the first half of 2010, as
on-going recovery in certain regions and technologies was offset by declines in legacy technologies. Our wireline business reflected pronounced weakness in spending for legacy ADSL access and core switching equipment, and our overall wireline
revenues dropped 18.7&nbsp;% in the first half of 2010. Our wireless business revenues fell 2.5&nbsp;% in the first half of 2010 due to declining spending in 2G legacy technologies (GSM and 2G CDMA) partially offset by increases in 3G wireless
technologies such as WCDMA and 3G CDMA (EV-DO) led by the explosive growth of mobile broadband data traffic. The rate of decline in wireless, however, eased significantly in the second quarter. Optics revenues
</FONT></P> </DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
declined 14.2&nbsp;% in the first half of 2010, with declines in both the terrestrial and submarine activities of this business. Revenues in our IP division increased 2.8&nbsp;% compared to the
first half of 2009 as strong growth in IP/MPLS service routers was largely offset by the continued secular decline in spending for legacy ATM equipment. Revenues in the Applications segment were essentially flat, with Network Applications declining
2.6&nbsp;% and Enterprise Applications increasing 0.3&nbsp;% in the first half of 2010 as compared to the same period of 2009. Revenues in our Services business segment declined slightly in the first half of 2010 driven by lower revenues in our
Maintenance and Network Build and Integration units partially offset by growth in Managed and Outsourcing Solutions. </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues for
the first half of 2010 and the same period in 2009 by geographical market (calculated based upon the location of the customer) are shown in the table below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;22&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
