<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">13&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;13&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;12&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;6&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In the first half of 2010, the United States accounted for 34.5&nbsp;% of
revenues, up from 28.8&nbsp;% in the same period in 2009 as revenues increased 13&nbsp;%. This region witnessed a recovery driven by an improved economy and key technologies such as IP and WCDMA in the first half of 2010. Europe accounted for
32.9&nbsp;% of revenues in the first half of 2010 (9.8&nbsp;% in France, 19.3&nbsp;% in Other Western Europe and 3.8&nbsp;% in Rest of Europe), down from 33.8&nbsp;% in the same period in 2009 (10.1&nbsp;% in
</FONT></P> </DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
France, 19.6&nbsp;% in Other Western Europe and 4.0&nbsp;% in Rest of Europe). Within Europe, revenue declined 9&nbsp;% year-over-year in France, fell 7&nbsp;% in Other Western Europe and dropped
11&nbsp;% in Rest of Europe. Weakness in Europe was spread across most businesses, with a few pockets of strength, like our IP/MPLS service routers. Revenues in the Asia Pacific market in the first half of 2010 decreased 22&nbsp;% from the same
period in 2009, as its share of total revenue decreased from 20.1&nbsp;% in </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>16</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
the first six months of 2009 to 16.6&nbsp;% in the same period of 2010. The year-over-year decline was mainly attributable to a slowdown in wireless spending in China following the transitions
from 2G to 3G that primarily occurred in 2009. Revenues in Other Americas in the first half of 2010 fell 13&nbsp;% from the same period in 2009 and its share of total revenue slipped from 7.9&nbsp;% to 7.3&nbsp;%. Rest of World also decreased its
share of total revenue to 8.8&nbsp;% in the first half of 2010, down from 9.4&nbsp;% in the same period in 2009, and had a 12&nbsp;% decrease in revenue. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Gross profit</I>. In the first half of 2010, gross profit increased to 34.5&nbsp;% of revenue, or
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2,435&nbsp;million, compared to 32.3&nbsp;% of revenue or
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2,426&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009. The increase in gross profit was mainly driven by
favorable product and geographic mix as well as ongoing initiatives to reduce costs. Gross profit in the first half of 2010 included (i)&nbsp;the negative impact of a net charge of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;61&nbsp;million for write-downs of inventory and work in progress; and (ii)&nbsp;the positive
impact of reversals of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;7&nbsp;million in reserves on customer receivables. Gross profit in the
first half of 2009 included (i)&nbsp;the negative impact of a net charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;61&nbsp;million for
write-downs of inventory and work in progress; and (ii)&nbsp;the negative impact of a net charge of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;17&nbsp;million of reserves on customer receivables. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We sell a wide variety of products in many geographic markets. Profitability per product can vary based on a product&#146;s
maturity, the required intensity of R&amp;D and our competitive position. In addition, profitability can be impacted by geographic area depending on the local competitive environment, our market share and the procurement policy of our customers.
During the first half of 2010, we witnessed a recovery in products and in geographic areas where our profitability has historically been above average. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Administrative and selling expenses.</I> For the first half of 2010, administrative and selling expenses were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,447&nbsp;million or 20.5&nbsp;% of revenues compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,537&nbsp;million, also 20.5&nbsp;% of revenues in the same period in 2009. Included in
administrative and selling expenses are non-cash purchase accounting entries resulting from the Lucent business combination of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;62&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010 and
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;61&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009. They primarily relate to the amortization of purchased
intangible assets of Lucent, such as customer relationships. The 5.9&nbsp;% decline in administrative and selling expenses reflects the progress we have made executing on our programs to reduce operating expenses by simplifying our
</FONT></P> </DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
organization and eliminating sales duplication between product groups and regions. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Research and development costs.</I> Research and development costs were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,296&nbsp;million or 18.4&nbsp;% of revenues in the first half of 2010, after the capitalization
of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(16)&nbsp;million of development expense, a decline of 3.6&nbsp;% from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,345&nbsp;million or 17.9&nbsp;% of revenues after the capitalization of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million of development expense in the same period in 2009. Capitalization of R&amp;D expense
was negative in the first half of 2010 reflecting the fact that the amortization of capitalized R&amp;D costs was greater than our R&amp;D costs capitalized during this period. Included in research and development costs are non-cash purchase
accounting entries resulting from the Lucent business combination of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;79&nbsp;million in each of the
first half of 2010 and the first half of 2009. The 3.6&nbsp;% decline in research and development costs reflects ongoing cost reduction plans, the progress we have made enhancing R&amp;D efficiency by focusing on four key segments - IP, optics,
broadband and applications - while we accelerate the shift of our investment toward next-generation platforms, partially offset by the negative impact of R&amp;D capitalization in the first half of 2010 as compared to the same period of 2009.
</FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from operating activities before restructuring costs, litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of
consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments.</I> We recorded a loss from operating activities before restructuring costs, litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments
of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(308)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010 compared to a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(456)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2009. The smaller loss in the first half of 2010 reflects
higher gross margins and lower operating expenses, which offset the impact of lower revenues. The purchase accounting entries had a negative, non-cash impact of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;141&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, which was similar to the impact of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;140&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Changes in provisions adversely impacted income (loss) from operating activities before restructuring costs, litigations,
gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments for the first six months of 2010 by
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;195&nbsp;million, of which
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;319&nbsp;million were additional provisions and
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;124&nbsp;million were reversals. Additional product sales reserves created during the first half of
2010 were <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;284&nbsp;million, while reversals of product sales reserves were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;87&nbsp;million during the same period. Of the
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;87&nbsp;million in reversals,
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;21&nbsp;million related
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>17</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
to reversals of reserves made in respect of warranties due to the revision of our original estimates for these reserves regarding warranty period and costs. This revision was due mainly to
(i)&nbsp;the earlier than expected replacement of products under warranty by our customers with more recent technologies and (ii)&nbsp;the product&#146;s actual performance leading to fewer warranty claims than anticipated and for which we had made
a reserve. In addition, <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;10&nbsp;million of the
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;87&nbsp;million reversal of product sales reserves was mainly related to reductions in probable
penalties due to contract delays or other contractual issues or in estimated amounts based upon statistical and historical evidence. The remaining reversals
(<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;56&nbsp;million) were mainly related to new estimates of losses at completion. Changes in
provisions adversely impacted income (loss) from operating activities before restructuring costs, litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments by
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;121&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, of which additional provisions were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;231&nbsp;million and reversals were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;110&nbsp;million. Additional product sales reserves created during the first half of 2009 were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;182&nbsp;million while reversals of product sales reserves were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;54&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Restructuring Costs.</I> Restructuring costs were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;244&nbsp;million for the first half of 2010, representing
(i)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;168&nbsp;million of new restructuring plans and adjustments to previous plans; (ii)&nbsp;a
valuation allowance and a write off of assets of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;22&nbsp;million in the aggregate; and
(iii)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;54&nbsp;million of other monetary costs. New restructuring plans cover costs related to
the elimination of jobs and to product rationalization and facilities closing decisions. Restructuring costs were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;201&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, representing
(i)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;113&nbsp;million of new restructuring plans or adjustments to previous plans; (ii)&nbsp;a
valuation allowance and a write-off of assets of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;43&nbsp;million in the aggregate; and
(iii)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;45&nbsp;million of other monetary costs. Our restructuring reserves of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;456&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2010 covered jobs identified for elimination and notified in the
first six months of 2010, as well as jobs eliminated in previous years for which total or partial settlement is still due, costs of replacing rationalized products, and other monetary costs linked to decisions to reduce the number of our facilities.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Litigations.</I> In the first half of 2010, we booked a litigation charge of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;16&nbsp;million related to the FCPA investigations (refer to Note&nbsp;23a of our unaudited
condensed interim consolidated financial statements). In the first half of 2009, we did not book any litigation charges. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities. </I>In the first half of 2010,
we booked a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;million loss related to the disposal of the Fractional Horsepower Motors
activity. There were no gains or losses on the disposal of consolidated entities in the first half of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Post-retirement benefit plan amendment.</I> In the first half of 2010, there was nothing booked in relation to post-retirement
benefit plan amendments. In the first half of 2009 we booked a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million reserve related to a
litigation, as disclosed in Note&nbsp;23e (&#147;Contingencies - Lucent&#146;s employment and benefits related cases&#148;) to our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements, that concerns a previous Lucent healthcare plan
amendment. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from operating activities.</I> Income (loss) from operating activities was a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(571)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, compared to a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(658)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2009. The smaller loss from operating activities in the
first half of 2010 is mostly due to higher gross margins, lower administrative and selling expenses and research and development expenses partially offset by higher restructuring costs, litigation charges and a loss on the disposal of the Fractional
Horsepower Motors activity. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Finance costs.</I> Finance costs in the first half of 2010 were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;148&nbsp;million, an increase from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;120&nbsp;million in the comparable year-ago period. The increase is due to a drop in interest
earned, from <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;38&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009 to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;30&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, in addition to an increase in interest paid, from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;158&nbsp;million in 2009 to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;178&nbsp;million in 2010. The 2010 increase in interest paid is primarily due to higher levels of
financial debt whereas the decline in interest earned is due to lower cash levels in 2010. The decrease of interest rates between the first half of 2009 and the corresponding period of 2010 also explains the decrease of interest earned between these
two periods. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Other financial income (loss).</I> Other financial income was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;85&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;142&nbsp;million in the same period in 2009. In the first half of 2010, other financial income
consisted primarily of (i)&nbsp;income of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;131&nbsp;million mainly related to the Lucent pension
credit. This was partially offset by a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;60&nbsp;million related to foreign exchange
transactions. In the first half of 2009, other financial income consisted primarily of (i)&nbsp;a capital gain of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;250&nbsp;million related to the disposal of Thales shares, (ii)&nbsp;a gain of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;50&nbsp;million related to </FONT></P>
</DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>18</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>

  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
the partial repurchase of Lucent&#146;s 7.75&nbsp;% bond due March&nbsp;2017, and (iii)&nbsp;a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;175&nbsp;million related to a change in the estimated future cash flows related to Lucent&#146;s
2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debenture. The <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;131&nbsp;million of other financial income in the

credit (<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT> 131 million in the first half of 2010 as compared to

lower interest costs due to the decrease in discount rates as explained in Note&nbsp;2-g of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Share in net income (losses) of equity affiliates.</I> Share in net income of equity affiliates was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;8&nbsp;million during the first half of 2010, compared with a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(6)&nbsp;million during the same period in 2009. The increase is largely due to the increase in net
income generated by 2Wire (On July&nbsp;25, 2010, we signed an agreement concerning the sale of our stake in 2Wire; see Section&nbsp;1.2 &#147;Highlights of Recent Events&#148; above). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) before income tax and discontinued operations.</I> Income (loss) before income tax and discontinued operations was
a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(626)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010 compared to a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(642)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income tax (expense) benefit.</I> We had an income tax expense of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(51)&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010, compared to an income tax benefit of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;93&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009. The income tax expense for the first
half of 2010 resulted from a current income tax charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(46)&nbsp;million in addition to a net
deferred income tax expense of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(5)&nbsp;million. The
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(5)&nbsp;million net deferred tax expense includes
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(102)&nbsp;million in deferred tax expenses related to Lucent&#146;s post-retirement benefit plan
mainly due to consequences of the recent Healthcare laws enacted in the U.S as well as
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(9)&nbsp;million in deferred tax expenses related to Lucent&#146;s 2.875&nbsp;% Series A
convertible bonds. These were partially offset by deferred income tax </FONT></P>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
benefits of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;62&nbsp;million related to the
reversal of deferred tax liabilities accounted for in the purchase price allocation of the Lucent combination and a
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;44&nbsp;million benefit related to the recoverability of the deferred tax assets mainly in
connection with the 2010 annual impairment test of goodwill performed in the second quarter 2010. The income tax benefit for the first half of 2009 resulted from a current income tax charge of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(11)&nbsp;million offset by a net deferred income tax benefit of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;104&nbsp;million. The <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;104&nbsp;million net deferred tax benefit includes deferred income tax benefits of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;62&nbsp;million related to the reversal of deferred tax liabilities accounted for in the purchase
price allocation of the Lucent combination and a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;68&nbsp;million reversal of deferred tax
liabilities related to the Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debenture. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from continuing
operations.</I> We had a loss from continuing operations of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(677)&nbsp;million in the first half of
2010 compared to a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(549)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from discontinued operations.</I> There was a loss from discontinued operations of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(13)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010 due to settlements of litigations related to businesses
disposed of in other periods. There was income from discontinued operations of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;129&nbsp;million in
the first half of 2009 due to an adjustment of the purchase price related to the contribution of our interests in two joint ventures in the space sector to Thales in 2007. (See Section 1.4 &#147;Highlights of Transactions during 2009&#148;).
</FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Non-controlling interests.</I> Non-controlling interests accounted for income of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;9&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, compared to a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(32)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009. The change from 2009 is due largely to the income from
our operations in China through Alcatel-Lucent Shanghai Bell. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Net income (loss) attributable to equity owners of the
parent.</I> A net loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(699)&nbsp;million was attributable to equity holders of the parent
during the first half of 2010, compared with a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(388)&nbsp;million in the first half of
2009. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>19</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_9">
</A>1.6 C<SMALL>ONSOLIDATED</SMALL> R<SMALL>ESULTS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> O<SMALL>PERATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> S<SMALL>IX</SMALL> M<SMALL>ONTHS</SMALL> E<SMALL>NDED</SMALL> J<SMALL>UNE</SMALL>&nbsp;30, 2009
C<SMALL>OMPARED</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> S<SMALL>IX</SMALL> M<SMALL>ONTHS</SMALL> <SMALL>ENDED</SMALL> J<SMALL>UNE</SMALL>&nbsp;30, 2008 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Revenues.</I> Revenues totaled
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;7,503&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, a decline of 5.8&nbsp;% from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;7,965&nbsp;million in the first half of 2008. Approximately 55&nbsp;% of our revenues are
denominated in or linked to the U.S. dollar. When we translate these sales into euros for accounting purposes, there is an exchange rate impact based on the relative value of the U.S. dollar and the euro. The increase in the value of the U.S. dollar
relative to the euro in the first half of 2009 compared with the first half of 2008 has tempered the decline in our reported revenues. If there had been a constant euro/U.S. dollar exchange rate in the first half of 2009 as compared to the first
half of 2008, our consolidated revenues would have declined by approximately 10.9&nbsp;% instead of the 5.8&nbsp;% decrease </FONT></P>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
actually experienced. This is based on applying (i)&nbsp;to our sales made directly in U.S. dollars or currencies linked to U.S. dollars effected during the first half of 2009, the average
exchange rate that applied for the same period in 2008, instead of the average exchange rate that applied for the first half of 2009, and (ii)&nbsp;to our exports (mainly from Europe) effected during the first half of 2009 which are denominated in
U.S. dollars and for which we enter into hedging transactions, our average euro / U.S. dollar hedging rate that applied for the same period in 2008. Our management believes that providing our investors with our revenues for the first half of 2009 in
constant euro / U.S. dollar exchange rates facilitates the comparison of the evolution of our revenues with that of the industry. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The table below
sets forth our revenues as reported, the conversion and hedging impact of the euro/U.S. dollar and our revenues at a constant rate: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:1px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Change</FONT></B></FONT></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;5.1&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Hedging impact euro/U.S. dollar</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">0.0&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Revenues at constant rate</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">7,099</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">7,965</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;10.9&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues in our Networks segment fell at a double-digit rate in the first half of
2009, as recessionary pressures on service provider capital expenditures were reflected to varying degrees on revenue growth across all four divisions that comprise the Networks segment. Spending cuts were, however, sharply focused on legacy
technologies. Our wireline business, for example, reflected pronounced weakness in spending for legacy core switching and, to a lesser extent, legacy ADSL access equipment, and our overall wireline revenues dropped sharply in the first half of 2009.
Similarly, in our wireless business, a sharp drop in spending for second-generation GSM equipment significantly outweighed increased spending for third-generation technologies, and overall wireless revenues fell at a double-digit rate. The rate of
decline in wireless, however, eased significantly in the second quarter. Revenues in our optics and IP divisions were more resilient. Optics revenue declined at a mid-single digit rate, as continued
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
weakness in terrestrial optics offset continued strong growth in submarine optics. There was a slight decline in revenues in our IP division as growth in IP/MPLS service routers was offset by the
continued secular decline in spending for legacy ATM equipment. Revenues in the Applications segment were essentially flat, as strong spending for carrier applications was offset by weak spending for enterprise applications (In 2009, enterprise
applications were part of the Enterprise segment, which also included Industrial Components. For ease of comparison with the discussion of the results of operations for the first half of 2010, the perimeter of the Applications segment resulting from
the new organization effective January&nbsp;1, 2010 was used for purposes of the previous sentence. In the reorganization, Industrial Components became part of &#147;Other&#148; activities of our Group). Revenues in our Services segment continued to
grow in the first half of 2009, led by very strong gains in Managed and Outsourcing Solutions. </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>20</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>

(calculated based upon the location of the customer) are shown in the table below: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">1st half 2009</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">1st half 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">2,403</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">672</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">679</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">7,965</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">% Change 1st half 2009 vs. 1st half 2008</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">18&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;13&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;29&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">4&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;10&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;12&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">4&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">-&nbsp;6&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In the first half of 2009, 70.5&nbsp;% of our revenue was generated in the
Europe and Americas regions, where the challenging economic environment pressured levels of activity across the board and revenue declined 9.3&nbsp;% from the first half of 2008. The Asia Pacific and Rest of World regions accounted for a combined
29.5&nbsp;% of revenue in the first half of 2009, and each region had an increase in first-half revenue of 4&nbsp;% over the year-ago period. More specifically, the United States accounted for 28.8&nbsp;% of revenues, down from 30.2&nbsp;% in the
same period in 2008 as revenues fell 10&nbsp;%. Weakness was widespread in that market with just a few areas, including applications and W-CDMA, able to post increased revenues in the face of economic headwinds. Europe accounted for 33.8&nbsp;% of
revenues in the first half of 2009 (10.1&nbsp;% in France, 19.6&nbsp;% in Other Western Europe and 4.0&nbsp;% in Rest of Europe), down from 34.6&nbsp;% in the same period in 2008 (8.1&nbsp;% in France, 21.2&nbsp;% in Other Western Europe and
5.4&nbsp;% in Rest of Europe). Within Europe, revenue increased 18&nbsp;% year-over-year in France due in part to gains in W-CDMA, but fell 13&nbsp;% in Other Western Europe and dropped 29&nbsp;% in Rest of Europe. Weakness in Europe was especially
pronounced in our enterprise business, offsetting a few pockets of strength, like our IP/MPLS service routers. Revenues in the Asia Pacific market in the first half of 2009 increased 4&nbsp;% from the same period in 2008, and increased their share
of total revenue from 18.3&nbsp;% in 2008 to 20.1&nbsp;% in 2009. Within Asia Pacific, our GSM business was particularly weak and our CDMA and W-CDMA businesses particularly strong, reflecting the transition from 2G to 3G wireless in China. Revenues
in Other Americas in the first half of 2009 fell 12&nbsp;% from the same period in 2008 and their share of total revenue slipped from 8.4&nbsp;% to 7.9&nbsp;%. Rest of World increased its share of total revenue to 9.4&nbsp;% in the first half of
2009, up from 8.5&nbsp;% in the same period in 2008, and had a 4&nbsp;% increase in revenue. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Gross profit</I>. In
the first half of 2009, gross profit decreased to 32.3&nbsp;% of revenue, or <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2,426&nbsp;million,
compared to 35.5&nbsp;% of revenue or </FONT></P>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2,829&nbsp;million in the first half of 2008.
The decrease in gross profit was mainly driven by lower volumes, unfavourable shifts in product and geographic sales mix, as well as the recovery of the U.S. dollar. Gross profit in the first half of 2009 included (i)&nbsp;the negative impact of a
net charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;61&nbsp;million for write-downs of inventory and work in progress; and (ii)&nbsp;the
negative impact of a net charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;17&nbsp;million of reserves on customer receivables. Gross
profit in the first half of 2008 included (i)&nbsp;the positive impact of a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;36&nbsp;million gain
from currency hedging; (ii)&nbsp;the positive impact of a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;20&nbsp;million gain from the sale of
real estate; (iii)&nbsp;the negative impact of a net charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;149&nbsp;million for write-downs of
inventory and work in progress; and (iv)&nbsp;the negative impact of a net charge of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;19&nbsp;million of reserves on customer receivables. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We sell a wide variety of products in many geographic markets. Profitability per product can vary based on their maturity, the
required intensity of R&amp;D and our competitive position. Likewise, profitability per geographic area can vary based on the local competitive environment, our market share and the procurement policy of operators. During the first half of 2009,
revenue contraction was generally more pronounced in products and in geographic areas where our profitability has historically been above average. Similarly, the products or areas where we enjoyed revenue growth during the first half of 2009 tended
to generate below average margins. The shift in the product and geographic mix witnessed in the first half of 2009 therefore negatively impacted our gross profit. </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>21</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
   <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We estimate that the increase in the value of the U.S. dollar versus the
euro which took place in the first half of 2009 compared to the first half of 2008 had a negative impact on our gross profit as a percentage of revenue. This is due to the fact, we believe, that the weight of the U.S. dollar and of currencies linked
to the U.S. dollar is higher as a percentage of the cost of goods sold than it is as a percentage of revenue. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Administrative and selling expenses.</I> For the first half of 2009, administrative and selling expenses were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,537&nbsp;million or 20.5&nbsp;% of revenues compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,546&nbsp;million or 19.4&nbsp;% of revenues in the same period in 2008. Included in
administrative and selling expenses are non-cash purchase accounting entries resulting from the Lucent business combination of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;61&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009 and
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;58&nbsp;million in the first half of 2008. They primarily relate to the amortization of purchased
intangible assets of Lucent, such as customer relationships. The 0.6&nbsp;% decline in administrative and selling expenses reflects the net impact of conflicting trends - the progress we have made executing on our programs to reduce operating
expenses by de-layering our organization and eliminating sales duplication between product groups and regions, which has been largely offset by the unfavourable currency impact of the recovery of the U.S. dollar on our U.S. dollar denominated
expenses. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Research and development costs.</I> Research and development costs were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,345&nbsp;million or 17.9&nbsp;% of revenues in the first half of 2009, after the capitalization
of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million of development expense, a decline of 4.6&nbsp;% from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,410&nbsp;million or 17.7&nbsp;% of revenues after the capitalization of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;57&nbsp;million of development expense in the same period in 2008. Included in research and
development costs are non-cash purchase accounting entries resulting from the Lucent business combination of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
</FONT>&nbsp;79&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009 and <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;195&nbsp;million in the first half of
2008. The decrease in purchase accounting entries reflects a decline in the amortization of purchased intangible assets of Lucent, including acquired technologies and in-process R&amp;D, mainly due to the impairment losses accounted for on these
intangible assets in 2008. Additionally, research and development costs in the first half of 2008 included a one-time gain of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;31&nbsp;million on the sale of intellectual property which was booked against our research and
development expense. The 4.6&nbsp;% decline in research and development costs reflects the progress we have made enhancing R&amp;D </FONT></P>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
efficiency by focusing on four key segments - IP, optics, broadband and applications - while we accelerate the shift of our investment toward next-generation platforms, and the reduced impact
from purchase accounting for the Lucent business combination. Those two factors have more than offset the unfavorable impacts of the sharp reduction in R&amp;D capitalization, the inclusion of the one-time gain in 2008 and the unfavourable currency
impact of the recovery of the U.S. dollar on our dollar denominated expenses. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from operating
activities before restructuring costs, impairment of assets, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments.</I> We recorded a loss from operating activities before restructuring costs, impairment of
assets, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(456)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009 compared to a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(127)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2008. The larger loss in the first half of 2009 reflects
the unfavorable impact of the global recession on volumes and pricing, and lower gross margins, all of which more than offset the favorable impacts of our product cost and fixed cost reduction programs and a decline in the purchase accounting
entries booked in the first half of 2009. The purchase accounting entries had a negative, non-cash impact of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
</FONT>&nbsp;140&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009 as compared to <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;256&nbsp;million in the
first half of 2008. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Changes in provisions adversely impacted income (loss) from operating activities before
restructuring costs, impairment of assets, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments for the first six months of 2009 by <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;121&nbsp;million, of which
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;231&nbsp;million were additional provisions and
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;110&nbsp;million were reversals. Additional product sales reserves (excluding construction
contracts) created during the first half of 2009 were <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;182&nbsp;million, while reversals of product
sales reserves were <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;54&nbsp;million during the same period. Of the
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;54&nbsp;million in reversals,
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;32&nbsp;million related to reversals of reserves made in respect of warranties due to the revision
of our original estimates for these reserves regarding warranty period and costs. This revision was due mainly to (i)&nbsp;the earlier than expected replacement of products under warranty by our customers with
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>22</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
more recent technologies and (ii)&nbsp;the product&#146;s actual performance leading to fewer warranty claims than anticipated and for which we had made a reserve. In addition,
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;10&nbsp;million of the <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;54&nbsp;million reversal of product sales reserves was mainly related to reductions in probable penalties due to contract delays or other contractual issues or in estimated
amounts based upon statistical and historical evidence. The remaining reversals (<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;12&nbsp;million)
were mainly related to new estimates of losses at completion. Changes in provisions adversely impacted income (loss) from operating activities before restructuring costs, impairment of intangible assets, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated
entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments by <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;107&nbsp;million in the first half of 2008,
of which additional provisions were <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;216&nbsp;million and reversals were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;109&nbsp;million. Additional product sales reserves created during the first half of 2008 were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;171&nbsp;million while reversals of product sales reserves were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;79&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Restructuring costs.</I> Restructuring costs were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;201&nbsp;million for the first half of 2009, representing
(i)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;113&nbsp;million of new restructuring plans and adjustments to previous plans; (ii)&nbsp;a
valuation allowance and a write off of assets of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;43&nbsp;million in the aggregate; and
(iii)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;45&nbsp;million of other monetary costs. New restructuring plans cover costs related to
the elimination of jobs and to product rationalization and facilities closing decisions. Restructuring costs were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;387&nbsp;million in the first half of 2008, representing
(i)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;367&nbsp;million of new restructuring plans or adjustments to previous plans; (ii)&nbsp;an
asset impairment loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;15&nbsp;million; and
(iii)&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;5&nbsp;million of other monetary costs. Our restructuring reserves of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;457&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2009 covered jobs identified for elimination and notified in the
first six months of 2009, as well as jobs eliminated in previous years for which total or partial settlement is still due, costs of replacing rationalized products, and other monetary costs linked to decisions to reduce the number of our facilities.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Impairment of assets.</I> In the first half of 2009, we had no asset impairment charges booked in this specific line
item. In the first half of 2008 we took an impairment of assets charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;810&nbsp;million related
to our CDMA business, all of which was related to goodwill. The impairment was due to the fact that in the second quarter of 2008, revenues from our CDMA business declined at a higher pace than we had estimated. This was due to a large extent to the
unexpected, strong reduction in the capital expenditure of a key customer in North America. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Post-retirement benefit plan amendment.</I> In the first half of 2009 we
booked an additional <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million reserve related to litigation, as disclosed in Note&nbsp;23-e
(&#147;Contingencies - Lucent&#146;s employment and benefits related cases&#148;) to our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements, that concerns a previous Lucent healthcare plan amendment. In the first half of 2008 we booked an
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;18&nbsp;million reserve related to ongoing litigation that concerns the same Lucent healthcare plan
amendment (see Note&nbsp;23-e for more detail). </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from operating activities.</I> Income (loss) from
operating activities was a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(658)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, compared to a loss
of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(1,343)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2008. The smaller loss from operating activities in
the first half of 2009 is mostly due to the combined impact of the absence of any impairment charge as compared with the
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;810&nbsp;million charge taken in 2008, and lower restructuring charges in the first half of 2009
compared with the same period in 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Finance costs.</I> Finance costs in the first half of 2009 were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;120&nbsp;million, an increase from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;98&nbsp;million in the comparable year-ago period. The increase is due to a drop in interest
earned, from <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;93&nbsp;million in 2008 to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;38&nbsp;million in 2009, that was larger than the decline in interest paid, from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;191&nbsp;million in 2008 to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;158&nbsp;million in 2009. The 2009 declines in both interest earned and interest paid are largely
due to lower levels of cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities and financial debt. The decrease of interest rates between the first half of 2008 and the corresponding period of 2009 explains also the decrease of interest earned between
these two periods. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Other financial income (loss).</I> Other financial income was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;142&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;193&nbsp;million in the same period in 2008. In the first half of 2009, other financial income
consisted primarily of (i)&nbsp;a capital gain of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;255&nbsp;million related to the disposal of
Thales shares, (ii)&nbsp;a gain of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;50&nbsp;million related to the partial repurchase of
Lucent&#146;s 7.75&nbsp;% bond due March&nbsp;2017, and (iii)&nbsp;a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;175&nbsp;million
related to a change in the estimated future cash flows related to Lucent&#146;s 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debenture. In the first half of 2008, other financial income consisted primarily of income of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;204&nbsp;million (as compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT> 14 million in the first half of 2009), which represented the difference between the expected financial
return on the assets (mainly for our U.S. plans) and the interest cost on the obligations of the pension and post-retirement benefit plans. The decrease of the </FONT></P>
</DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>23</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>
