<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
pension credit is mainly due to the decrease in the expected rate of return and the fair value of the plan assets as explained in Note&nbsp;2-g of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated
financial statements. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Share in net income (losses) of equity affiliates.</I> Share in net losses of equity
affiliates was <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(6)&nbsp;million during the first half of 2009, compared with income of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;56&nbsp;million during the same period in 2008. The decline is largely due to the reclassification
of our Thales shares from net assets in equity affiliates to assets held for sale as of the announcement on December&nbsp;19, 2008 of a definitive agreement to sell our stake in Thales to Dassault Aviation. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) before income tax and discontinued operations.</I> Income (loss) before income tax and discontinued operations
was a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(642)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009 compared to a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(1,192)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2008. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income tax (expense) benefit.</I> We had an income tax benefit of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;93&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009, compared to an income tax expense of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(69)&nbsp;million for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2008. The income tax benefit for the first
half of 2009 resulted from a current income tax charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(11)&nbsp;million offset by a net
deferred income tax benefit of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;104&nbsp;million. The
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;104&nbsp;million net deferred tax benefit includes deferred income tax benefits of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;62&nbsp;million related to the reversal of deferred tax
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
liabilities accounted for in the purchase price allocation of the Lucent combination and a
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;68&nbsp;million reversal of deferred tax liabilities related to the Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% Series A
convertible debentures. The <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(69)&nbsp;million income tax expense for the first six months of 2008
resulted from a current income tax charge of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(53)&nbsp;million and a net deferred income tax charge
of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(16)&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from continuing operations.</I> We had a loss from continuing operations of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(549)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009 compared to a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(1,261)&nbsp;million in the same period of 2008. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from discontinued operations.</I> There was income from discontinued operations of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;129&nbsp;million (after external advisors&#146; fees) in the first half of 2009 due to an
adjustment of the purchase price for the Space activities that were sold to Thales in 2007. There was no income (loss) from discontinued operations in the first half of 2008. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Non-controlling Interests.</I> A
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(32)&nbsp;million loss was attributable to non-controlling interests in the first half of 2009,
compared with income of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;22&nbsp;million in the first half of 2008. The change from 2008 is due
largely to deteriorated operations in China from Alcatel-Lucent Shanghai Bell. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Net income (loss) attributable
to equity owners of the parent.</I> A net loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(388)&nbsp;million was attributable to equity
owners of the parent during the first half of 2009, compared with a loss of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(1,283)&nbsp;million in
the first half of 2008. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_10">
</A>1.7 R<SMALL>ESULTS</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> O<SMALL>PERATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL> B<SMALL>USINESS</SMALL> S<SMALL>EGMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> S<SMALL>IX</SMALL> M<SMALL>ONTHS</SMALL> E<SMALL>NDED</SMALL>
J<SMALL>UNE</SMALL>&nbsp;30, 2010 C<SMALL>OMPARED</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> S<SMALL>IX</SMALL> M<SMALL>ONTHS</SMALL> <SMALL>ENDED</SMALL> J<SMALL>UNE</SMALL>&nbsp;30, 2009 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The following discussion takes into account our results of operations for the
six-month periods ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 and June&nbsp;30, 2009, with results presented according to the new organization structure that became effective January&nbsp;1, 2010. The new organization includes three business segments: Networks,
Applications, and Services, while the old organization structure
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
that was in place in 2009 consisted of four business segments - Carrier, Enterprise, Services, and Applications Software. Results of operations for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2009 were
originally presented according to the old organization structure but are presented here according to the new organization structure in order to facilitate comparison with the current period.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>24</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The table below sets forth certain financial information on a segment basis for
the six-month periods ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 and June&nbsp;30, 2009. Segment operating income (loss) is the measure of operating segment profit or loss that is used by our Chief Executive Officer to perform his chief operating decision making
function, assess performance and allocate resources. It consists of segment income (loss) from operating activities before restructuring costs, litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan
amendments, excluding the main non-cash impacts of the purchase price </FONT></P>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
allocation (PPA) entries relating to the Lucent business combination. Adding &#147;PPA Adjustments (excluding restructuring costs and impairment of assets)&#148; to segment operating income
(loss), as shown in the table below, reconciles segment operating income (loss) with income (loss) from operating activities before restructuring costs, litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan
amendments, as shown in the table below and the unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">

<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Capital expenditures</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">50</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">29</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">16</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">340</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>PPA adjustments (excluding restructuring costs and impairment of
assets).</I> PPA adjustments (excluding restructuring costs and impairment of assets) remained almost stable in the first half of 2010,
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(141)&nbsp;million compared with
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(140)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, reflecting the fact that the amortization of
purchased intangible assets of Lucent, including long-term customer relationships, acquired technologies and in-process R&amp;D was little changed in the first half of 2010 compared with the first half of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Income (loss) from operating activities before restructuring costs, litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated
entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments.</I> In the first half of 2010, a segment operating loss of
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(167)&nbsp;million for the Group, adjusted
for <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(141)&nbsp;million in PPA yields a loss from operating activities before restructuring costs,
litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
</FONT>&nbsp;(308)&nbsp;million, as shown in the unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. In the first half of 2009, a segment operating loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(316)&nbsp;million for the Group, adjusted for
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(140)&nbsp;million in PPA yields a loss from operating activities before restructuring costs,
litigations, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendments of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
</FONT>&nbsp;(456)&nbsp;million, as shown in the unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>25</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Networks Segment
 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues in our Networks segment were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4,232&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, a decline of 8.1&nbsp;% from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4,603&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, using current exchange rates. When we translate these
sales into euros for accounting purposes, there is an exchange rate impact based on the relative value of the euro versus other currencies, including the U.S. dollar. The increase in the value of other currencies, including the U.S. dollar, relative
to the euro in the first half of 2010 vs. the first half of 2009 has tempered the decline in our reported revenues. If there had been constant exchange rates in the first half of 2010 as compared to the first half of 2009, our networks segment
revenues would have declined by approximately 10&nbsp;% instead of the 8.1&nbsp;% decrease actually reported. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues
in our IP division were <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;590&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, an increase of 2.8&nbsp;% from
the first half of 2009, as double digit growth in IP/MPLS service routers, which accelerated strongly as the first half of the year progressed, was largely offset by a material decline in ATM switching revenue. The growth in service router revenues
reflects strong momentum in North America and Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA) and good traction in the IP/MPLS mobile backhaul segment. The decline in ATM revenues reflects the continuing market-wide contraction in spending for that legacy
technology. We continue to gain market share in the edge IP routing space, and in the first quarter of this year, we took over the No.&nbsp;1 position in IP Edge routing in the EMEA region, and reinforced our No.&nbsp;2 global position at 20%,
according to Infonetics. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues in our Optics division were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,189&nbsp;million, a decrease of 14.2&nbsp;% from the first half of 2009, with declines in both
the terrestrial and submarine segments of our Optics business. Our refreshed, next-generation terrestrial optics portfolio includes new packet optical and microwave packet radio technology, as well as a new WDM platform. The success of our new WDM
platform, combined with a recovery in the WDM market that has been driven by the need for additional capacity, resulted in strong growth in our WDM business in the first half of 2010, particularly in North America. After sustained strong growth in
2009, our submarine optics business declined at a double digit rate in the first half of 2010 as some large projects were completed or neared completion, while some new contracts have not yet started generating revenue and decisions on some other
expected projects have been delayed. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">There were contrasting demand trends at play in our Wireless networks division,
where revenues of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,840&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010 were down 2.5&nbsp;% from the
year-ago period. The single most important factor in this market today is the explosive growth in mobile broadband data traffic that is being driven by the growing penetration of smartphones, and the increased spending for new equipment by mobile
operators to accommodate that growth. Thus far, that phenomenon is most apparent in North America, where smartphone penetration is higher than it is in other regions. Furthermore, it is largely limited to 3G (third generation) networks because they
offer the broadband data capabilities demanded by smartphone users. Our own first-half wireless results clearly reflect those market trends. Our 3G WCDMA wireless revenues increased very strongly driven primarily by the North American market.
Similarly, the 3G CDMA (EV-DO) piece of our CDMA business also increased, paced by strength in North America, although our overall CDMA business declined in the first half of 2010. At the same time, our 2G (second generation) wireless businesses -
GSM and 2G CDMA - reflected market-wide declines in spending for those legacy technologies. Finally, the momentum behind 4G (fourth generation) LTE continued to build, driven by the surging growth in mobile broadband data volumes, and we remain a
global leader in the LTE market, with more than 50 LTE trials and 4 commercial contracts, including our selection by Verizon last year and our selection in the first half of 2010 by AT&amp;T. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Activity in our Wireline networks division was materially impacted by legacy-focused cutbacks in service provider spending for new
equipment, particularly in ADSL access and core switching. We are also deploying new wireline technologies, including VDSL2 and pair bonding, with carriers like AT&amp;T to extend the reach of their existing copper access infrastructure. In next
generation fiber-based access, sales growth picked up significantly in the second quarter of 2010, and we were selected as a strategic supplier for the rollout of Australia&#146;s National Broadband Network. Overall, however, the decline in legacy
spending predominated and wireline revenues fell 18.7&nbsp;%, to <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;664&nbsp;million in the first half
of 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The Networks segment registered an operating loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(73)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, considerably smaller than the segment operating loss
of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(290)&nbsp;million recorded in the year-ago period. Moreover, profitability continued to improve
in the second quarter, when operating income of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;55&nbsp;million was recorded. The
</FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>26</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
significant improvement in segment operating margin over the year ago period reflects the impact of ongoing initiatives to reduce costs and expenses, particularly fixed operations, procurement
and product design costs, as well as favorable shifts in product and geographic sales mix, which combined to offset the negative impact of lower overall volumes. The contribution to improved profitability from the Wireless division was especially
strong. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Applications
 Segment </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues in our Applications segment were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;905&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010 compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;906&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, a decrease of 0.1&nbsp;% at current exchange rates. If
there had been constant exchange rates in the first half of 2010 as compared to the first half of 2009 our Applications revenues would have decreased by about 1&nbsp;% instead of the 0.1&nbsp;% reported decrease. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In the first half of 2010, revenues in our Network applications business declined 2.6&nbsp;% to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;337&nbsp;million from <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;346&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, with a pickup in growth taking place in the second quarter. During the first half however, there was solid growth in revenue
from the year-ago period primarily in focus areas such as Applications Enablement and applications professional services. This reflects our decision last year to refocus the portfolio to better align with key corporate growth initiatives such as
Applications Enablement. The growth in these areas however is offset by declines in some of our legacy applications, notably messaging and payment. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In the Enterprise applications business revenues in the first half of 2010 were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;576&nbsp;million, an increase of 0.3&nbsp;% from
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;574&nbsp;million in the year ago period, as a decline in the first quarter was offset by a return
to growth in the second quarter. Data networking revenues increased, but voice telephony reflected continuing weakness in corporate investment in Europe. Genesys, our contact center software business, picked up considerably in the second quarter
after a weak first quarter and showed a small overall increase for the first half compared with the year-ago period. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The Applications segment operating loss was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(44)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, compared with a segment operating loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(85)&nbsp;million in the year-ago period. The smaller loss in 2010 reflected the impact of cost
reduction actions, particularly in the Enterprise applications business. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Services Segment
 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues in our Services business segment were
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,655&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010, a decrease of 0.9&nbsp;% from revenues of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,670&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009, using current exchange rates. If there had been
constant exchange rates in the first half of 2010 as compared to the first half of 2009 our Services segment revenues would have declined by about 5&nbsp;% instead of the 0.9&nbsp;% decrease actually reported. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Managed and Outsourcing Solutions grew at a single digit rate in the first half of 2010, but revenue growth slowed noticeably in
the second quarter as uncertainty about the global economy resulted in delays in roll-out activity at some existing customers. Market opportunities remain healthy in this segment, and we are investing in our delivery center in India to better
leverage those opportunities while enhancing our global services delivery model. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Revenues in the Networks and System
Integration (NS&amp;I) division were flat, but strengthened in the second quarter on a strong performance in North America. Strong order intake was marked by gains in North America and carried the NS&amp;I order backlog to a historically very high
level. Within NS&amp;I, first half activity was led by gains in the network design, integration and optimization business. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In the Network Build and Integration unit, which is focused on civil works usually attached to the sale of our equipment, growth in
the Americas helped to stabilize revenues after a very weak first quarter, but revenues decreased overall in the first half. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Despite continued strong growth in Multi-vendor maintenance, the overall maintenance business continued to be pressured by lower
revenues from the maintenance of our products as service providers strive to cut the maintenance piece of their operating expense. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The Services segment operating loss was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(21)&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010 compared with income of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;24&nbsp;million in the year-ago period, although there was significant improvement from the first
quarter to the second quarter as the business reconfigures its supply chain and enhances the efficiency of its global service delivery model. </FONT></P> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>27</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_11">
</A>1.8 L<SMALL>IQUIDITY</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> C<SMALL>APITAL</SMALL> R<SMALL>ESOURCES</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Liquidity
 </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Cash and cash equivalents decreased by
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;524&nbsp;million in the first half 2010 to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;3,053&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2010. This decrease was mainly due to cash used by operating
activities of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;586&nbsp;million and to cash used by financing activities of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;356&nbsp;million, the latter resulting primarily from the reimbursement, repurchase or redemption
of financial debt, which was partially offset by the positive impact of the net effect of exchange rate changes of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;429&nbsp;million, reflecting mainly the change of the euro/U.S. dollar exchange rate on cash and
cash equivalent denominated in U.S. dollars </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Net cash provided (used) by operating activities</I>. Net cash used by
operating activities before changes in working capital, interest and taxes was <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;291&nbsp;million for
the first half 2010 compared to <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;425&nbsp;million of net cash used for the first half 2009.
</FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The decrease in net cash used by operating activities before changes in working capital, interest and taxes
between the first half 2009 and the first half 2010 is mainly due to a net positive adjustment of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;204&nbsp;million in the first half 2010 in respect of financial interest, income taxes, gains on
disposal of assets and results of discontinued operations (which included mainly the cancellation of net tax income expense and finance costs) compared to a net negative adjustment of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;372&nbsp;million for the first half 2009 (which included
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;129&nbsp;million for discontinued operations corresponding to the purchase price adjustment to be
received in the first half 2009 with respect to the disposal in 2007 of our space businesses to Thales,
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;270&nbsp;million of gains on disposal of assets including
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;255&nbsp;million for the disposal of the shares of Thales that we owned, and the cancellation of
net tax income, partially offset by the cancellation of finance costs). On the other hand, the non-cash impacts on the financial result in connection with the repurchases of bonds and changes of estimates related to the Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% Series A
convertible debentures represented a positive adjustment of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;125&nbsp;million in the first half 2009
compared to a negative adjustment of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;24&nbsp;million in the first half 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Net cash used by operating activities was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;586&nbsp;million for the first half 2010 compared to net cash used of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;891&nbsp;million for the first half 2009. These amounts take into account the net
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
cash used by operating working capital, vendor financing and other current assets and liabilities that amounted to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;74&nbsp;million for the first half 2010 and to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;310&nbsp;million for the first half 2009. This change is explained by net cash provided of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;521&nbsp;million for the first half 2010 in respect of (i)&nbsp;trade receivables and other
receivables, (ii)&nbsp;advances and progress payments, (iii)&nbsp;trade payables and other payables and (iv)&nbsp;other non-operating assets and liabilities compared to net cash used of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;288&nbsp;million for these same elements for the first half 2009, partially offset by an increase
in net cash used by inventories and work in progress and customers&#146; deposit and advances of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;595&nbsp;million in the first half 2010 compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;22&nbsp;million in the first half 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Net cash provided (used) by investing activities.</I> Net cash used by investing activities was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;11&nbsp;million in the first half 2010 compared to net cash provided of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,177&nbsp;million in the first half 2009. The difference is mainly due to the net cash of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,566&nbsp;million provided from the disposal of our investment in Thales, which was partially
offset by the <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;104&nbsp;million in cash expenditures for the acquisition of marketable securities in
the first half 2009 compared to cash proceeds of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;248&nbsp;million from the disposal of marketable
securities for the first half 2010 and the decrease of purchases of tangible and intangible fixed assets between the first half of 2009
(<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;340&nbsp;million) and the first half of 2010
(<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;278&nbsp;million). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Net cash provided (used) by financing activities.</I> Net cash used by financing activities amounted to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;356&nbsp;million for the first half 2010 compared to net cash used of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;876&nbsp;million for the first half 2009. This decrease was mainly due to the fact that the
repurchase and repayment before maturity date due to the partial exercise of an optional redemption right on the Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible bonds used US$&nbsp;75&nbsp;million and US$&nbsp;360&nbsp;million respectively in the first
half 2010, whereas the redemption of the 4.375&nbsp;% bonds maturing February&nbsp;2009 used an amount of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;777&nbsp;million and the partial repurchase of the Lucent 7.75&nbsp;% convertible bonds used
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;21&nbsp;million in the first half of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Disposed of or discontinued operations.</I> Disposed of or discontinued operations provided no cash for the first half of
2010, compared to net cash of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;118&nbsp;million provided for the first half 2009 (actual cash
received due to the positive purchase price adjustment for the space businesses we sold to Thales in 2007). </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>28</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Capital
Resources </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Resources and cash flow outlook.</I> Our capital resources may be derived from a variety
of sources, including the generation of positive cash flow from on-going operations, the issuance of debt and equity in various forms, and banking facilities, including our revolving credit facility of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1.4&nbsp;billion maturing in April&nbsp;2012 (of which
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;837&nbsp;million has been extended until April&nbsp;5, 2013), and on which we have not yet drawn
(see &#147;Syndicated facility&#148; in Note&nbsp;19-d of the unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements). Our ability to draw upon these resources at any time is dependent upon a variety of factors, including our customers&#146;
ability to make payments on outstanding accounts receivable, lenders&#146; and investors&#146; perception of our credit quality, our ability to meet the financial covenant for our revolving facility and debt and equity market conditions generally.
Given current conditions, we cannot rely on our ability to access to the debt and equity markets at any given time. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Our short-term cash requirements are primarily related to funding our operations, including our restructuring program, capital
expenditures and short-term debt repayments. We believe that our cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, including short-term investments, aggregating
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4,841&nbsp;million as of June&nbsp;30, 2010, are sufficient to fund our cash requirements for the
next 12&nbsp;months. Approximately <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,062&nbsp;million of our cash, cash equivalents and marketable
securities are held in countries, primarily China, which are subject to exchange control restrictions. These restrictions may limit the use of such funds by our subsidiaries outside of the local jurisdiction. Repatriation efforts are underway to
reduce that amount. We do not expect that such restrictions will have an impact on our ability to meet our cash obligations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In July 2009, we announced new restructuring plans in various European countries that are fully
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
reserved as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. The estimated cash outlays in respect of restructuring plans should be lower in 2010 than in 2009, that is, approximately
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;500&nbsp;million (of which of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;213&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010) compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;561&nbsp;million in 2009 (of which
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;282&nbsp;million in the first half 2009). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We expect capital expenditures in 2010 to be similar to those in 2009, which amounted to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;691&nbsp;million including capitalization of development expenditures. We spent
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;278&nbsp;million in the first half of 2010; consequently, we expect capital expenditures to be
higher for the second half of the year. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We repaid a total of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;327&nbsp;million in respect of the Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible bond through
repurchases that occurred in the first quarter of 2010 (US$&nbsp;75&nbsp;million) and repayment before maturity date due to the partial exercise of an optional redemption right on June&nbsp;2010 (US$&nbsp;360&nbsp;million). Our Oceane 4.75&nbsp;%
will mature on January&nbsp;2011, representing a nominal amount to be repaid of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;818&nbsp;million.
</FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Based on our current view of our business and capital resources and the overall market environment, we believe
we have sufficient resources to fund our operations. If, however, the business environment were to materially worsen, the credit markets were to limit our access to bid and performance bonds, or our customers were to dramatically pull back on their
spending plans, our liquidity situation could deteriorate. If we are unable to generate sufficient cash from operations to meet cash requirements in excess of our current expectations, we might be required to obtain extra funds through additional
operating improvements or through external sources, such as capital market proceeds, assets sales or financing from third parties, the availability of which is dependent upon a variety of factors, as noted above.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Credit
ratings.</I> At August 6, 2010, the credit ratings of Alcatel-Lucent were as follows: </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

as follows: </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP></FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">n.a.</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">November&nbsp;9, 2009</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="center" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">November&nbsp;9,&nbsp;2009</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Except for preferred notes and bonds that continue to be rated (last update February&nbsp;18, 2009). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Moody&#146;s:</U> On February&nbsp;18, 2009, Moody&#146;s lowered the
Alcatel-Lucent Corporate Family Rating, as well as the rating for senior debt of the Group, from Ba3 to B1. The trust preferred securities of Lucent Technologies Capital Trust I were downgraded from B2 to B3. The Not-Prime rating for the
Group&#146;s short-term debt was confirmed. The negative outlook was maintained. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">On April&nbsp;3, 2008, Moody&#146;s
affirmed the Alcatel-Lucent Corporate Family Rating as well as that of the debt instruments originally issued by historical Alcatel and Lucent. The outlook was changed from stable to negative. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The rating grid of Moody&#146;s ranges from AAA, which is the highest rated class, to C, which is the lowest rated class. Our B1
rating is in the B category, which also includes B2 and B3 ratings. Moody&#146;s gives the following definition of its B1 category: &#147;obligations rated B are considered speculative and are subject to high credit risk.&#148; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s</U>: On November&nbsp;9, 2009, Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s lowered to B from B+ its
long-term corporate credit ratings and senior unsecured ratings on Alcatel-Lucent and on Alcatel-Lucent USA Inc. The B short&#150;term credit rating of Alcatel-Lucent was affirmed. The rating on the trust preferred securities of Lucent Technologies
Capital Trust I was lowered from CCC+ to CCC. The negative outlook was maintained. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The rating grid of
Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s ranges from AAA (the strongest rating) to D (the weakest rating). Our B rating is in the B category, which also includes B+ and B- ratings. Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s gives the following definition to the B
category: &#147;An obligation rated &#147;B&#148; is more vulnerable to non-payment than obligations rated &#147;BB&#148; but the obligor currently has the capacity to meet its financial commitment on the obligation. Adverse business, financial or
economic conditions likely will impair the obligator&#146;s capacity or willingness to meet its financial commitment on the obligation.&#148; </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The CCC rating for the trust preferred securities of Lucent Technologies Capital
Trust I is in the CCC category, which also includes CCC+ and CCC- ratings. Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s gives the following definition to the CCC category: &#147;An obligation rated &#147;CCC&#148; is currently vulnerable to non payment, and is
dependent upon favorable business, financial, and economic conditions for the obligor to meet its financial commitment on the obligation. In the event of adverse business, financial, or economic conditions, the obligor is not likely to have the
capacity to meet its financial commitment on the obligation.&#148; </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">We can provide no assurances that our credit
ratings will not be lowered in the future by Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s, Moody&#146;s or similar rating agencies. In addition, a security rating is not a recommendation to buy, sell or hold securities, and each rating should be evaluated
separately of any other rating. Our current short-term and long-term credit ratings as well as any possible future lowering of our ratings may result in higher financing costs and in reduced access to capital markets. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s short-term debt rating allows a limited access to the French commercial paper market for short periods of
time. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Total Financial Debt</I>. At June&nbsp;30, 2010, our total financial debt, gross was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4,811&nbsp;million compared to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4,755&nbsp;million at December&nbsp;31, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Short-term Debt.</I> At June&nbsp;30, 2010, we had <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,040&nbsp;million of short-term financial debt outstanding, which included
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;816&nbsp;million related to the Oceane 4.75&nbsp;% due January&nbsp;2011, with the remainder
representing bank loans and lines of credit and other financial debt and accrued interest payable. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Long-term
Debt.</I> At June&nbsp;30, 2010 we had <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;3,771&nbsp;million of long-term financial debt outstanding.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>30</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Rating Clauses Affecting our Debt.</I> Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s and Alcatel-Lucent
USA Inc.&#146;s outstanding bonds do not contain clauses that could trigger an accelerated repayment in the event of a lowering of their respective credit ratings. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Syndicated Facility.</I> On April&nbsp;5, 2007, Alcatel-Lucent obtained a
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1.4&nbsp;billion multi-currency syndicated five-year revolving bank credit facility (with two
one-year extension options). This facility replaced the undrawn <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;billion syndicated facility,
which was to mature in June&nbsp;2009. On March&nbsp;21, 2008, <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;837&nbsp;million of availability
under the facility was extended until April&nbsp;5, 2013. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The availability of this syndicated credit facility of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1.4&nbsp;billion is not dependent upon Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s credit ratings. Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s
ability to draw on this facility is conditioned upon its compliance with a financial covenant linked to the capacity of Alcatel-Lucent to generate sufficient cash to repay its net debt and compliance is tested quarterly when we release our
consolidated financial statements. Since the <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1.4&nbsp;billion facility was established, we have
complied every quarter with the financial covenant that is included in the facility. The facility was undrawn at the date of approval by Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s Board of Directors of these financial statements.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_12">
</A>1.9 C<SMALL>ONTRACTUAL</SMALL> <SMALL>OBLIGATIONS</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>OFF</SMALL>-<SMALL>BALANCE</SMALL> <SMALL>SHEET</SMALL> <SMALL>CONTINGENT</SMALL> <SMALL>COMMITMENTS</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Contractual obligations.</I> We have certain contractual obligations that extend beyond 2010. Among these obligations we have
long-term debt and interest thereon, finance leases, operating leases, commitments to purchase fixed assets and other unconditional purchase obligations. Our total contractual cash obligations at June&nbsp;30, 2010 for these items are presented
below based upon the minimum payments we will have to make in the future under such contracts and firm commitments. Amounts related to financial debt, finance lease obligations and the equity component of our convertible bonds are fully reflected in
our unaudited condensed interim consolidated balance sheet included in this document. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

than<BR>one year</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">2011-2012

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">2013-2014
</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">2015&nbsp;
and<BR>after</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Total</FONT>
</B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Financial debt (excluding finance leases)</FONT></TD>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Of which
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;49&nbsp;million related to a finance leaseback arrangement concerning IT infrastructure assets sold
to Hewlett Packard Company (&#147;HP&#148;). See &#147;Outsourcing Transactions&#148; below. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">To compute finance costs on financial debt, all put dates have been considered as redemption dates. For debentures with calls but no puts, call dates have not
been considered as redemption dates. Further details on put and call dates are given in Note&nbsp;17 of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. If all outstanding debentures at June&nbsp;30, 2010 were not redeemed at their
respective put dates, an additional finance cost of approximately <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;265&nbsp;million (of which
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;11&nbsp;million would be incurred in 2013 and the remaining part in 2014 and later) would be
incurred until redemption at their respective contractual maturities. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Of which
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,789&nbsp;million relate to commitments made to HP pursuant to the sales cooperation agreement and
the IT outsourcing transaction entered into with HP, described in &#147;Outsourcing Transactions&#148; below. Other unconditional purchase obligations result mainly from obligations under multi-year supply contracts linked to the sale of businesses
to third parties. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

Note&nbsp;20 of our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>31</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Off-balance Sheet Commitments and Contingencies.</I> On June&nbsp;30, 2010,
our off-balance sheet commitments and contingencies amounted to <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,979&nbsp;million, consisting
primarily of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;997&nbsp;million in guarantees on long-term contracts for the supply of
telecommunications equipment and services by our consolidated and non-consolidated subsidiaries. Generally we provide these guarantees to back performance bonds issued to customers through financial institutions. These performance bonds and
counter-guarantees are standard industry practice and are routinely provided in long-term supply contracts. If certain events occur subsequent to our including these commitments within our
</FONT></P> </DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
off-balance sheet contingencies, such as the delay in promised delivery or claims related to an alleged failure by us to perform on our long-term contracts, or the failure by one of our customers
to meet its payment obligations, we reserve the estimated risk on our consolidated statement of financial position under the line items &#147;Provisions&#148; or in inventory reserves. Not included in the
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,979&nbsp;million is approximately
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;380&nbsp;million in customer financing provided by us. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">With respect to guarantees given for contract performance, only those issued by us to back guarantees granted by financial
institutions are presented in the table below. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Off-balance
sheet contingent commitments given in the normal course of business are as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
