<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">The cash pooling guarantee is granted to the banks operating the Group&#146;s cash pooling. This guarantee covers the risk involved in any overdrawn position that
could remain outstanding after the many daily transfers between Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s Central Treasury accounts and those of its subsidiaries. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The amounts of guarantees given on contracts reflected in the preceding table
represent the maximum potential amounts of future payments (undiscounted) we could be required to make under current guarantees granted by us. These amounts do not reflect any amounts that may be recovered under recourse, collateralization
provisions in the guarantees or guarantees given by customers for our benefit. In addition, most of the parent company guarantees and performance bonds given to our customers are insured; therefore, the estimated exposure related to the guarantees
set forth in the preceding table may be reduced by insurance proceeds that we may receive in case of a claim. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Commitments related to product warranties and pension and post-retirement benefits are not included in the preceding table. These
commitments are fully reflected in our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. Contingent liabilities arising out of
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
litigation, arbitration or regulatory actions are not included in the preceding table either, with the exception of those linked to the guarantees given on our long-term contracts. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Commitments related to contracts that have been cancelled or interrupted due to the default or bankruptcy of the customer are
included in the above-mentioned &#147;Guarantees given on contracts made by entities within the Group and by non-consolidated subsidiaries&#148; as long as the legal release of the guarantee has not been obtained. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Guarantees given on third-party long-term contracts could require us to make payments to the guaranteed party based on a
non-consolidated company&#146;s failure to perform under an agreement. The fair value of these contingent liabilities, corresponding to the premium to be received by the guarantor for issuing the guarantee, was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2&nbsp;million as of June&nbsp;30, 2010 and also as of June&nbsp;30, 2009.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>32</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In connection with our consent solicitation to amend the indenture pursuant to
which Lucent&#146;s 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debentures due 2023 and 2.875&nbsp;% Series B convertible debentures due 2025 were issued, on December&nbsp;29, 2006 we issued a full and unconditional guaranty of these debentures. The guaranty
is unsecured and is subordinated to the prior payment in full of our senior debt and is <I>pari passu</I> with our other general unsecured obligations, other than those that expressly provide that they are senior to the guaranty obligations. These
subordinated guarantees are not included in the preceding table. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Outsourcing Transactions</I>. During 2009,
Alcatel-Lucent entered into a major IT outsourcing transaction with Hewlett Packard Company (&#147;HP&#148;). Alcatel-Lucent is also finalizing further outsourcing transactions with other service providers concerning payroll and certain R&amp;D and
business process activities. The IT outsourcing transaction, which has an effective date of December&nbsp;1, 2009, was signed with HP on October&nbsp;20, 2009, at the same time as a ten-year sales cooperation agreement with HP was signed.
</FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The IT outsourcing transaction provides for HP to transform and manage a large part of Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s IT
infrastructure. As part of an initial 18-month transition and transformation phase, HP will invest its own resources to transform Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s global IT/IS platforms. As a result, Alcatel-Lucent is committed to restructuring its IT/IS
operations, which is estimated to cost <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;200&nbsp;million over ten years. These restructuring costs,
which include severance costs and the costs of transferring certain legal entities and resources to HP, are recognized as incurred, starting in 2010.
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;17&nbsp;million of these restructuring costs were incurred during the six months period ended
June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As part of the transfer of resources, Alcatel-Lucent has sold to HP IT infrastructure assets under
a sale and finance leaseback arrangement, the payment obligations for which are included in &#147;Finance lease obligations&#148; in the Contractual Payment Obligations table above, representing a total amount of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;49&nbsp;million in finance lease obligation as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Also as part of the overall arrangement with HP, Alcatel-Lucent has committed to purchase
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;202&nbsp;million of additional HP goods and services to be used in the context of customer networks
over a four-year period until October&nbsp;31, 2013. The finance lease obligations and the unconditional
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
purchase commitments related to this agreement are included in the contractual payment obligations table, presented above under the headings &#147;Finance lease obligations&#148; and
&#147;Unconditional purchase obligations&#148;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The two following commitments were also included in the HP agreement:
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">A minimum value commitment regarding the amount of IT Managed services to be purchased or procured by Alcatel-Lucent from HP and/or any HP
affiliates over ten years, for a total amount of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,408&nbsp;million (which amount includes
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;120&nbsp;million of the <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;
</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;200&nbsp;million restructuring costs mentioned above) and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">commitment to make certain commercial efforts related to the development of sales pursuant to the sales cooperation agreement, including the
establishment of dedicated teams, representing a minimum investment of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;298&nbsp;million over ten
years. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">These two commitments for the remaining part as of June&nbsp;30, 2010 are included in the
Contractual Payment Obligations table presented above, under the heading &#147;Unconditional purchase obligations&#148;. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Customer Financing. </I>Based on standard industry practice, we extend financing to certain of our customers by granting
extended payment terms, making direct loans, or providing guarantees to third-party financing sources. More generally, as part of our business, we routinely enter into long-term contracts, which can involve our customers paying significant amounts
over long periods of time. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As of June&nbsp;30, 2010, net of reserves of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT> 27 million, we had an exposure of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;295&nbsp;million under drawn customer financing arrangements, representing approximately
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;288&nbsp;million of deferred payments and loans, and
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;7&nbsp;million of guarantees. In addition, as of this date, we had further commitments to provide
customer financing for approximately <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;58&nbsp;million. It is possible that these further commitments
will expire without our having to actually provide the committed financing. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Outstanding customer financing and
undrawn commitments are monitored by assessing, among other things, each customer&#146;s short-term and long-term liquidity positions, the customer&#146;s current operating performance versus plan, the execution challenges faced by the customer,
changes in the </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>33</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
competitive landscape, and the customer&#146;s management experience and depth. When we detect potential problems, we take mitigating actions, which may include the cancellation of undrawn
commitments. Although by taking such actions we may be able to limit the total amount of our exposure, we still may suffer losses to the extent of the drawn and guaranteed amounts. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Lucent Guaranty of Alcatel-Lucent Public Bonds. </I>On March&nbsp;27, 2007, Lucent issued full and unconditional guaranties of
our 6.375&nbsp;% notes due 2014 (the principal amount of which was <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;462&nbsp;million on
June&nbsp;30, 2009) and our 4.750&nbsp;% Convertible and/or Exchangeable Bonds due 2011 (the principal amount of which was
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,022&nbsp;million on June&nbsp;30, 2009). Each guaranty is unsecured and is subordinated to the
prior payment in full of Lucent&#146;s senior debt and is <I>pari passu</I> with Lucent&#146;s other general unsecured obligations, other than those that expressly provide that they are senior to the guaranty obligations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Customer Credit Approval Process and Risks.</I> We engage in a thorough credit approval process prior to providing financing to
our customers or guarantees to financial institutions, which provide financing to our customers. Any significant undertakings have to be approved by a central Trade and Project Finance group and by a central Risk Assessment Committee, each
independent from our commercial departments. We continually monitor and manage the credit we have extended to our customers, and attempt to limit credit risks by, in some cases, obtaining security interests or by securitizing or transferring to
banks or export credit agencies a portion of the risk associated with this financing. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Although, as discussed above, we
engage in a rigorous credit approval process and have taken actions to limit our exposure to customer credit risks, if economic conditions and the telecommunications industry in particular were to deteriorate, leading to the financial failure of our
customers, we may realize losses on credit we extended and loans we made to our customers, on guarantees provided for our customers and losses relating to our commercial risk exposure under long-term contracts, as well as the loss of our
customer&#146;s ongoing business. In such a context, should customers fail to meet their obligations to us, we may experience reduced cash flows and losses in excess of reserves, which could materially adversely impact our results of operations and
financial position. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Capital Expenditures. </I>We expect a stable amount of capital expenditures in
2010 compared to the <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;691&nbsp;million, including capitalization of development expenditures, that
was spent in 2009 (of which <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;340&nbsp;million during the first half 2009 and
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;351&nbsp;million during the second half 2009). We expect therefore to make capital expenditures in
the second half of 2010 of a higher amount than what we spent in the first half of the year
(<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;278&nbsp;million for the first half 2010). We believe that our current cash, cash equivalents and
marketable securities and funding arrangements provide us with adequate flexibility to meet our short-term and long-term financial obligations and to pursue our capital expenditure program, as planned. To the extent that business environment
materially deteriorates or our customers reduce their spending plans, we will revaluate our capital expenditure priorities appropriately. We may be also required to engage in additional restructuring efforts and seek additional sources of capital,
which may be difficult if there is no continued improvement in the market environment and given our limited ability to access the fixed income market at this point. In addition, as mentioned in &#147;Capital Resources&#148; above, if we do not meet
the financial covenant contained in our syndicated facility, we may not be able to rely on that funding arrangement to meet our cash needs. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>34</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_13">
</A>1.10 Q<SMALL>UALITATIVE</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> Q<SMALL>UANTITATIVE</SMALL> D<SMALL>ISCLOSURES</SMALL> A<SMALL>BOUT</SMALL> M<SMALL>ARKET</SMALL> R<SMALL>ISK</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Financial
 instruments </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Although, at June&nbsp;30, 2010, our exposure to financial market risks was not
materially different from our exposure at the end of last year, as described in our 2009 Form 20-F, outstanding amounts may vary significantly according to underlying exposures and fair value of derivative instruments changes depending on market
conditions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">No significant change occurred in the first half 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As a result of our hedging transactions, the fixed rate debt part of our gross
financial debt represents approximately 90&nbsp;% of our total gross debt as of June&nbsp;30, 2010 and December&nbsp;31, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As noted in our 2009 - Form 20-F, we are exposed to credit risk on marketable securities, cash and cash equivalents and
derivative instruments in the event of counterparty default. We closely monitor this credit risk daily remaining within strict limits based on the counterparties&#146; credit ratings. As of today, we have not suffered any significant loss due to a
counterparty default. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"><A NAME="toc54975_14">
</A>1.11 R<SMALL>ESEARCH</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> D<SMALL>EVELOPMENT</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><I>Cost</I>. During the first half 2010, our research and development costs
amounted to <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,296&nbsp;million, including the impact of the capitalization of development costs,
the capital gain (loss) on disposal of fixed assets and the impact of the purchase price allocation entries for the business combination with Lucent, as disclosed in Note&nbsp;5b of the unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements
included elsewhere in this document, which represented 18.4&nbsp;% of revenues of the period, compared to </FONT></P>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
  <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
costs of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,345&nbsp;million in the first half
of 2009, which represented 17.9&nbsp;% of the revenues for that period. Excluding the impact of the capitalization of development costs and capital gain (loss) on disposal of fixed assets and the impact of the purchase price allocation entries of
the business combination with Lucent, research and development costs amounted to <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,215&nbsp;million
for the first half 2010 compared with <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1,267&nbsp;million for the first half 2009. </FONT></P>
</DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>36</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Translation of amounts from euros
(&#147;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&#148;) into U.S. dollars (&#147;$&#148;) has been made merely for the convenience of the reader
at the Noon Buying Rate of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1 = $&nbsp;1.2291 on June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

Note&nbsp;8. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

2009 of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;93&nbsp;million representing the net present value of US$&nbsp;137.4&nbsp;million) and the
Fox River litigation (Lucent&#146;s separation agreements for an amount of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;16&nbsp;million or
US$&nbsp;22&nbsp;million). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Translation of amounts from euros

at the Noon Buying Rate of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1 = $ 1.2291 on June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

</FONT></B></FONT></TD>

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Translation of amounts from euros
(&#147;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&#148;) into U.S. dollars (&#147;$&#148;) has been made merely for the convenience of the reader
at the Noon Buying Rate of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1 = $ 1.2291 on June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>40</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>42</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="6" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="6"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="6" COLOR="#333333">NOTES TO
UNAUDITED CONDENSED INTERIM CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS </FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Alcatel-Lucent (formerly called Alcatel) is a French public limited liability
company that is subject to the French Commercial Code and to all the legal requirements governing commercial companies in France. On November&nbsp;30, 2006, Alcatel changed its name to Alcatel-Lucent on completion of the business combination with
Lucent Technologies Inc. Alcatel-Lucent was incorporated on June&nbsp;18, 1898 and will be dissolved on June&nbsp;30, 2086, unless its existence is extended or shortened by shareholder vote. Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s headquarters were situated at 54,
rue la Bo&eacute;tie, 75008 Paris, France up to May&nbsp;17, 2010 and from that date are now situated at 3, avenue Octave Gr&eacute;ard, 75007, Paris, France. Alcatel-Lucent is listed principally on the Paris and New York stock exchanges.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The condensed interim consolidated financial statements reflect the results and
financial position of Alcatel-Lucent and its subsidiaries (the &#147;Group&#148;) as well as its investments in associates (&#147;equity affiliates&#148;) and joint ventures. They are presented in Euros rounded to the nearest&nbsp;million.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The Group develops and integrates technologies, applications and services to offer innovative global communications
solutions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">On July&nbsp;29, 2010, the Board of Directors authorized the issuance of these condensed interim
consolidated financial statements at June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">N<SMALL>OTE
</SMALL> 1. S<SMALL>UMMARY</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>ACCOUNTING</SMALL> <SMALL>POLICIES</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Due to the listing of Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s securities on the Euronext Paris and in
accordance with the European Union&#146;s regulation No.&nbsp;1606/2002 of July&nbsp;19, 2002, the consolidated financial statements of the Group are prepared in accordance with IFRSs (International Financial Reporting Standards), as adopted by the
European Union (&#147;EU&#148;), as of the date when our Board of Directors authorized these consolidated financial statements for issuance. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">IFRSs can be found at: www.ec.europa.eu/internal_market/accounting/ias_en.htm#adopted-commission. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">IFRSs include the standards approved by the International Accounting Standards Board (&#147;IASB&#148;), that is, IFRSs,
International Accounting Standards (&#147;IASs&#148;) and accounting interpretations issued by the International Financial Reporting Interpretations Committee (&#147;IFRIC&#148;) or the former Standing Interpretations Committee (&#147;SIC&#148;).
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As of June&nbsp;30, 2010, all IFRSs that the IASB has published and that are
mandatory are the same as those endorsed by the EU and mandatory in the EU, with the exception of: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">IAS&nbsp;39, which the EU only partially adopted. The part not adopted by the EU has no impact on Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s financial statements; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">amendments to IFRS 1 &#147;First-Time Adoption of IFRSs - Additional Exemptions for First-Time Adopters&#148; (issued July&nbsp;2009).
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The above improvements and amendments, which are not yet mandatory in the EU, are either not
applicable to the Group or will have no significant impact on Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s financial statements when adopted by the EU. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As a result, the Group&#146;s consolidated financial statements comply with International Financial Reporting Standards as
published by the IASB. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>43</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The condensed interim consolidated financial statements at June&nbsp;30, 2010 are prepared in compliance with IAS 34
&#147;Interim Financial Reporting&#148;. The accounting policies and measurement principles adopted for the condensed consolidated financial statements as of and for the six months ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 are the same as those used in the audited
consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2009, except for the change in the accounting for business combinations and non-controlling interests disclosed below.

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>44</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><B>Business combinations after January&nbsp;1, 2010 </B><I>(IFRS3 revised and IAS
27 amended):</I> compared to accounting for business combinations that the Group completed before January&nbsp;1, 2010, the principal changes are: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For each business combination, the acquirer measures any non-controlling interest in the acquiree either at fair value or at the non-controlling
interest&#146;s proportionate share of the acquiree&#146;s net identifiable assets. Previously, only the latter was permitted; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">the transitional provisions of revised IFRS 3 concerning income taxes could have a material impact on our future consolidated financial
statements, because deferred tax assets recognized for the first time after the end of the business combination&#146;s measurement period will be recognized in the income statement and no longer adjusted against goodwill, contrary to the accounting
treatment prescribed in previous IFRS 3 (see Note&nbsp;1n of the 2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F). In this respect, significant unrecognized income tax loss carry-forwards that relate to Lucent
Technologies could materially impact the Group&#146;s consolidated income statement in a positive way, if, in compliance with IAS 12 &#147;Income Taxes&#148;, the Group is able to recognize deferred tax assets in the future corresponding to these
tax losses; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">the acquirer is no longer permitted to recognize contingencies acquired in a business combination that is not a present obligation of the
acquiree at the date of the business combination; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">costs the acquirer incurs in connection with a business combination must be accounted for separately from the business combination, which usually
means that they are recognized as expenses (rather than included in goodwill); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">consideration transferred by the acquirer, including contingent consideration, is measured and recognized at fair value at the acquisition date.
Subsequent changes in the fair value of contingent consideration classified as liabilities are recognized in accordance with IAS 39, IAS 37 or other IFRSs, as appropriate (rather than by adjusting goodwill); and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">an acquirer must remeasure any equity interest it holds in the acquiree immediately before achieving control at its acquisition-date fair value
and recognize the resulting gain or loss, if any, in profit or loss. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><B><I>Non-controlling
interests after January&nbsp;1, 2010</I></B>: compared to accounting for non-controlling interests before January&nbsp;1, 2010, the principal changes are: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Changes in Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in loss of control are accounted for within equity; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">when Alcatel-Lucent loses control of a subsidiary, the assets and liabilities and related equity components of the former subsidiary are
derecognized. Any gain or loss is recognized in profit or loss. Any investment retained in the former subsidiary is measured at its fair value at the date when control is lost. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Condensed
 interim consolidated financial statements </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><U>Seasonal
 nature of activity</U> </FONT></I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Interim net sales and income from operations are highly seasonal due to a high
level of activity during the last quarter of the year, particularly in December. This characteristic varies from year to year. Pursuant to the IFRS accounting principles, interim net sales are accounted for under the same principles as year-end net
sales; that is, in the period in which they are achieved. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>45</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">N<SMALL>OTE
</SMALL> 2. P<SMALL>RINCIPAL</SMALL> <SMALL>UNCERTAINTIES</SMALL> <SMALL>REGARDING</SMALL> <SMALL>THE</SMALL> <SMALL>USE</SMALL> <SMALL>OF</SMALL> <SMALL>ESTIMATES</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The preparation of consolidated financial statements in accordance with IFRSs
requires that the Group makes a certain number of estimates and assumptions that are considered realistic and reasonable. In the context of the current global economic environment, the degree of volatility and subsequent lack of visibility remains
particularly high as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. Subsequent facts and circumstances could lead to changes in these estimates or assumptions, which would affect the Group&#146;s financial condition, results of operations and cash flows. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">a/
Valuation allowance for inventories and work in progress </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Inventories and work in progress are measured at
the lower of cost or net realizable value. Valuation allowances for inventories and work in progress are calculated based on an analysis of foreseeable changes in demand, technology or the market, in order to determine obsolete or excess inventories
and work in progress. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The valuation
allowances are accounted for in cost of sales or in restructuring costs depending on the nature of the amounts concerned. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

months&nbsp;ended<BR>June&nbsp;30, 010</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">b/
Impairment of customer receivables </FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">An impairment loss is recorded for customer receivables if the expected value of
the future receipts is below the nominal value. The amount of the impairment loss reflects both the customers&#146; ability to honor their debts and the age of the
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
debts in question. A higher default rate than estimated or the deterioration of Alcatel-Lucent major customers&#146; creditworthiness could have an adverse impact on the Group&#146;s future
results. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The criteria for capitalizing development costs are set out in Note&nbsp;1f of the
2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F. Once capitalized, these costs are amortized over the estimated useful lives of the products concerned (3 to 10&nbsp;years). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The Group must therefore evaluate the commercial and technical feasibility of these development projects and estimate the useful
lives of the products resulting from the projects. Should a product fail to substantiate these assumptions, the Group may be required to impair or write off some of the capitalized development costs in the future. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">An impairment loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;3&nbsp;million for capitalized development costs was accounted for in the first six months of 2010,
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;16&nbsp;million in the first six months of 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">During the fourth quarter of 2009, following the Group&#146;s decision to cease any new WiMAX development on the existing
hardware platform and software release, restructuring costs of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;44&nbsp;million were reserved.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Other
intangible assets and goodwill </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Intangible assets, net <SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Total</FONT></B></FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6,937</FONT>
</B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6,382</FONT>
</B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Including capitalized development costs. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Goodwill amounting to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;8,051&nbsp;million and intangible assets amounting to
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4,813&nbsp;million were accounted for in 2006 as a result of the Lucent business combination as
described in Note&nbsp;3 to our 2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F, using market-related information, estimates (primarily based on risk adjusted discounted cash flows derived from Lucent&#146;s
management) and judgment (in particular in determining the fair values relating to the intangible assets acquired). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">No impairment loss was accounted for during the first six months of 2010 and 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The carrying value of each group of cash generating units at which level goodwill is monitored for internal management purposes
(i.e. Product Division) is compared to its recoverable value. The recoverable value is the higher of the value in use and the fair value less costs to sell. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The value in use of each Product Division is calculated using a five year discounted cash flow analysis plus a discounted
residual value, corresponding to the capitalization to perpetuity of the normalized cash flows of year 5 (Gordon Shapiro approach).
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The fair value less cost to sell of each Product Division is determined based upon
the weighted average of the Gordon Shapiro approach described above and the following two approaches: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Five year discounted cash flow analysis plus a Sales Multiple (Enterprise Value-&#148;EV&#148;/Sales) to measure discounted residual value; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">five year discounted cash flow analysis plus an Operating Profit Multiple (Enterprise Value-&#148;EV&#148;/Earnings Before Interest, Tax,
Depreciation and Amortization-&#148;EBITDA&#148;) to measure discounted residual value. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The
recoverable values of our goodwill and intangible assets, as determined for the impairment tests performed by the Group in the second quarter of 2010, are based on key assumptions which could have a significant impact on the consolidated financial
statements. Some of these key assumptions are: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Discount rate; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">a nominal growth (defined as between 0&nbsp;% and 5&nbsp;%) for the telecommunications equipment and related services market in 2010; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>47</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">projected cash-flows which are based on a segment operating income (as defined in Note&nbsp;5) for 2010 and 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The discount rate used for the annual impairment test of 2010 was the Group&#146;s weighted average cost of capital
(&#147;WACC&#148;) of 10 %. This discount rate is an after-tax rate applied to after-tax cash flows. The use of such rate results in recoverable values that are identical to those that would be obtained by using, as required by IAS 36, pre-tax rates
applied to pre-tax cash flows. A single discount rate is used on the basis that risks specific to certain products or markets have been reflected in determining the cash flows. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Holding all other assumptions constant, a 0.5&nbsp;% increase or decrease in the discount rate would have decreased or increased
the 2010 recoverable value of goodwill and intangible assets by <I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>792&nbsp;million and
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>894&nbsp;million, respectively. An increase of 0.5&nbsp;% in the discount rate would not
have impacted impairment losses as of June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In addition to the annual goodwill impairment tests that
occur during the second quarter of each year, impairment tests are carried out if Alcatel-Lucent has indications of a potential reduction in the value of its goodwill or intangible assets. Possible impairments are based on discounted future cash
flows and/or fair values of the assets concerned. Changes in the market conditions or the cash flows initially estimated can therefore lead to a review and a change in the impairment losses previously recorded. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Due to the change in the economic environment and the volatile behaviour of financial markets, the Group assessed whether as of
March&nbsp;31, 2010 and December&nbsp;31, 2009 there was any indication that any Product Division goodwill may be impaired at that date. The Group concluded that there were no triggering events that would justify performing an additional impairment
test as of March&nbsp;31, 2010 and December&nbsp;31, 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">d/
Impairment of property, plant and equipment </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In accordance with IAS&nbsp;36 &#147;Impairment of
Assets&#148;, when events or changes in market conditions indicate that tangible or intangible
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
assets may be impaired, such assets are reviewed in detail to determine whether their carrying value is lower than their recoverable value, which could lead to recording an impairment loss
(recoverable value is the higher of value in use and fair value less costs to sell) (see Note&nbsp;1g of the 2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F). Value in use is estimated by calculating the present
value of the future cash flows expected to be derived from the asset. Fair value less costs to sell is based on the most reliable information available (such as market statistics and recent transactions). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">When determining recoverable values of property, plant and equipment, assumptions and estimates are made, based primarily on
market outlooks, obsolescence and sale or liquidation disposal values. Any change in these assumptions can have a significant effect on the recoverable amount and could lead to a revision of recorded impairment losses. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The planned closing of certain facilities, additional reductions in personnel and unfavorable market conditions have been
considered impairment-triggering events in prior years. No impairment loss on property, plant and equipment was accounted for in 2009 or in the six month period ended June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">e/
Provision for warranty costs and other product sales reserves </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Provisions are recorded for
(i)&nbsp;warranties given to customers on Alcatel-Lucent products, (ii)&nbsp;expected losses at completion and (iii)&nbsp;penalties incurred in the event of failure to meet contractual obligations. These provisions are calculated based on historical
return rates and warranty costs expensed as well as on estimates. These provisions and subsequent changes to the provisions are recorded in the income statement either when revenue is recognized (provision for customer warranties) or, for
construction contracts, when revenue and expenses are recognized by reference to the stage of completion of the contract activity. Costs and penalties ultimately paid can differ considerably from the amounts initially reserved and could therefore
have a significant impact on future results. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>48</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2009
</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Related to construction contracts</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">125</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">114</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Related to other contracts <SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">(1)</SUP></FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">See Note&nbsp;18. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For further information on the impact on the income statement of changes in these provisions, see Note&nbsp;18. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">f/
Deferred taxes </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Deferred tax assets relate primarily to tax loss carry-forwards and to deductible temporary
differences between reported amounts and the tax
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
bases of assets and liabilities. The assets relating to the tax loss carry-forwards are recognized if it is probable that the Group will generate future taxable profits against which these tax
losses can be set off. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
