</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;
&nbsp;</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="right" COLSPAN="1" VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">836
</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD COLSPAN="1" NOWRAP VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;
&nbsp;</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Following the performance of the 2009 annual goodwill impairment test, a reassessment of deferred taxes resulted in reducing the deferred tax assets recorded in
the United States and increasing those recognized in France compared to the situation as of December&nbsp;31, 2008. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(2)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Following the performance of the 2010 annual goodwill impairment test, a reassessment of deferred taxes resulted in increasing deferred tax assets recorded in
France. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Evaluation of the Group&#146;s capacity to utilize tax loss carry-forwards relies
on significant judgment. The Group analyzes past events and the positive and negative elements of certain economic factors that may affect its business in the foreseeable future to determine the probability of its future utilization of these tax
loss carry-forwards, which also consider the factors indicated in Note&nbsp;1n of the 2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F. This analysis is carried out regularly in each tax jurisdiction where
significant deferred tax assets are recorded. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">If future taxable results are considerably different from those
forecast that support recording deferred tax assets, the Group will be obliged to revise downwards or upwards the amount of the deferred tax assets, which would have a significant impact on Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s statement of financial position and
net income (loss). </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As a result of the business combination with Lucent,
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2,395&nbsp;million of net deferred tax liabilities were recorded as of December&nbsp;31, 2006,
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
resulting from the temporary differences generated by the differences between the fair value of assets and liabilities acquired (mainly intangible assets such as acquired technologies) and their
corresponding tax bases. These deferred tax liabilities will be reduced in the future Group income statements as and when such differences are amortized. The remaining deferred tax liabilities related to the purchase price allocation of Lucent as of
June&nbsp;30, 2010 are <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;819&nbsp;million
(<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;751&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2009). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As prescribed by IFRSs, Alcatel-Lucent had a twelve-month period to complete the purchase price allocation and to determine
whether certain deferred tax assets related to the carry-forward of Lucent&#146;s unused tax losses that had not been recognized in Lucent&#146;s historical financial statements should be recognized in the combined company&#146;s financial
statements. If any additional deferred tax assets attributed to the combined company&#146;s unrecognized tax losses existing as of the transaction date are recognized in future financial statements, the tax benefit will be included in the income
statement. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>49</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">g/ Pension
and retirement obligations and other employee and post-employment benefit obligations </FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Actuarial
 assumptions </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s results of operations include the impact of significant pension and
post-retirement benefits that are measured using actuarial valuations. Inherent in these valuations are key assumptions, including assumptions about
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
discount rates, expected return on plan assets, healthcare cost trend rates and expected participation rates in retirement healthcare plans. These assumptions are updated on an annual basis at
the beginning of each fiscal year or more frequently upon the occurrence of significant events. In addition, discount rates are updated quarterly for those plans for which changes in these assumptions would have a material impact on
Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s results or equity attributable to equity owners of the parent. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="66%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="12%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="12%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Six&nbsp;
months&nbsp;ended<BR>June&nbsp;30, 2010</FONT></B></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Six&nbsp;
months&nbsp;ended<BR>June&nbsp;30, 2009</FONT></B></FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Weighted average expected rates of return on pension and post-retirement plan assets</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6.55&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6.79&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Weighted average discount rates used to determine the pension and post-retirement expense</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">5.43&nbsp;%</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6.44&nbsp;%</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The net effect of pension and post-retirement costs included in &#147;income (loss)
before tax and discontinued operations&#148; was a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;112&nbsp;million increase in pre-tax income
during the first six months of 2010 (<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>150&nbsp;million increase in pre-tax income during 2009
and a <I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>72&nbsp;million decrease in pre-tax income during the first six months 2009). Included
in the <I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>150&nbsp;million increase in 2009 was
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>253&nbsp;million booked as a result of certain changes to management retiree pension and
healthcare benefit plans (refer to Note&nbsp;20). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Discount
 rates </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Discount rates for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. plans are determined using the values published
in the &#147;original&#148; CitiGroup Pension Discount Curve, which is based on AA-rated corporate bonds. Each future year&#146;s expected benefit payments are discounted by the discount rate for the applicable year listed in the CitiGroup Curve,
and for those years beyond the last year presented in the CitiGroup Curve for which we have expected benefit payments, we apply the discount rate of the last year presented in the Curve. After applying the discount rates to all future years&#146;
benefits, we calculate a single discount rate that results in the same interest cost for the next period as the application of the individual rates would have produced. Discount rates for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s non U.S. plans are determined based on
Bloomberg AA Corporate yields. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Holding all other assumptions constant, a 0.5&nbsp;% increase or decrease in the
discount rate would have decreased or increased the 2009 net pension and post-retirement result by approximately
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>(35)&nbsp;million and
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>49&nbsp;million, respectively. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Expected
 return on plan assets </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Expected return on plan assets for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. plans are
determined based on recommendations from our external investment advisor and our own experienced historical returns. Our advisor develops its recommendations by applying the long-term return expectations it develops for each of many classes of
investments, to the specific classes and values of investments held by each of our benefit plans. Expected return assumptions are long-term assumptions and are not intended to reflect expectations for the period immediately following their
determination. Although these assumptions are reviewed each year, we do not update them for small changes in our advisor&#146;s recommendations. However, the pension expense or credit for our U.S. plans is updated every quarter using the fair value
of assets and discount rates as of the beginning of the quarter. The expected return on plan assets (accounted for in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148;) for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. plans for the second quarter of 2010 is based on
March&nbsp;31, 2010 plan asset fair values. However, the expected return on plan assets for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s non U.S. plans for each quarter of 2010 is based on the fair values of plan assets at December&nbsp;31, 2009.
</FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>50</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Holding all other assumptions constant, a 0.5&nbsp;% increase or decrease in the
expected return on plan assets would have increased or decreased the 2009 net pension and post-retirement result by approximately
<I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;</I>122&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For its U.S. plans, Alcatel-Lucent recognized a US$&nbsp;13&nbsp;million increase in the net pension credit between the first and
second quarters of 2010, which is accounted for in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148;. This increase corresponds to a higher expected return on plan assets for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. plans due to the increase in plan asset fair values and
a lower interest cost due to a decrease in discount rates. Alcatel-Lucent expects a US$&nbsp;25&nbsp;million increase in the net pension credit for its U.S. plans to be accounted for in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; between the second
and the third quarters of 2010 for the same reasons. Alcatel-Lucent does not anticipate a material impact outside its U.S. plans. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Healthcare
 inflation trends </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Regarding healthcare inflation trend rates for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. plans, our
actuaries annually review expected cost trends from numerous healthcare providers, recent developments in medical treatments, the utilization of medical services, and Medicare future premium rates published by the U.S. Government&#146;s Center for
Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) as these premiums are reimbursed for some retirees. They apply these findings to the specific provisions and experience of Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. post-retirement healthcare plans in making their
recommendations. In determining our assumptions, we review our recent experience together with our actuary&#146;s recommendations. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Participation
 assumptions </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. post-retirement healthcare plans allow participants to opt out
of coverage at each annual enrollment period, and for almost all to opt back in at any future annual enrollment. An assumption is developed for the number of eligible retirees who will elect to participate in our plans at each future enrollment
period. Our actuaries develop a recommendation based on the expected increases in the cost to be paid to a retiree participating in our plans and recent participation history. We review this recommendation annually after the annual enrollment has
been completed and update it if necessary. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Mortality
 assumptions </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The mortality assumption for Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s U.S. plans is based on actual recent
experience of the participants in our management pension plan and our occupational pension plans. For the 2009 year-end valuation, we updated the mortality assumptions, again based on the actual experience of the two plans. We looked at the
experience for the years of 2004 through 2008. As was the case previously, there was insufficient experience to develop assumptions for active employees and former employees who have delayed commencing their pension benefits, so we used the RP 2000
mortality table projected up to year 2009. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Plan
assets investment </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">At its meeting on July&nbsp;29, 2009, the Board of Directors approved the following
modifications to the asset allocation of&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s pension funds: the investments in equity&nbsp;securities were to be reduced from&nbsp;22.5&nbsp;% to 15&nbsp;% and the investments in bonds were to be increased from 62.5&nbsp;% to
70&nbsp;%, while investments in alternatives (i.e., real estate, private equity and hedge funds) were to remain unchanged.&nbsp;The reduction in equity investments in favor of fixed income securities was achieved immediately.&nbsp;The implementation
of the asset allocation approved on July&nbsp;29, 2009 was completed as of January&nbsp;1, 2010. We believe that these changes should lead to a slight decrease in long-term returns from financial assets. The impact of these changes has been
reflected in our expected return assumptions for year 2010. </FONT></P>  <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Plan assets are invested in many different asset
categories (such as cash, equities, bonds, real estate and private equity). In the quarterly update of plan asset fair values, approximately 80&nbsp;% are based on closing date fair values and 20&nbsp;% have a one to three month delay, as the fair
values of private equity, venture capital, real estate and absolute return investments are not available in a short period. This is standard practice in the investment management industry. Assuming that the June&nbsp;30, 2010 actual fair values of
private equity, venture capital, real estate and absolute return investments were 10&nbsp;% lower than the ones used for accounting purposes as of June&nbsp;30, 2010, and since the Management Pension Plan has a material investment in these asset
classes (the asset ceiling is not applicable to this plan), equity would be negatively impacted by approximately
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;250&nbsp;million. </FONT></P>
</DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>51</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">2010 US
Health Care Legislation </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">On March&nbsp;23, 2010, the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA)
was signed into law; and on March&nbsp;30, 2010, the Health Care and Education Reconciliation&nbsp;Act of 2010 (HCERA) that amended the PPACA was also signed into law.&nbsp;Under the new legislation, the subsidy paid to Alcatel-Lucent by Medicare
for continuing to provide prescription drug benefits to the Group&#146;s U.S. employees and retirees that are at least equivalent to those provided by Medicare Part D, will no longer be tax free after 2012.&nbsp;This change in law resulted in
a&nbsp;write-down of our deferred tax assets which caused a&nbsp;<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;76&nbsp;million charge to the
consolidated income statement and a <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;6&nbsp;million profit to the consolidated statement of
comprehensive income (refer to Note&nbsp;11). In addition, reductions in the Medicare payments to Medicare Advantage plans, such as our Private Fee For Service plan which we offer to our U.S. management retirees, resulted in the need to change our
related cost assumption, with an increase in our benefit obligation of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;6&nbsp;million recognized in
the consolidated statement of comprehensive income as an actuarial loss (see Note&nbsp;20).&nbsp;There are several other provisions that may&nbsp;affect our post-retirement health care benefit obligations but for which additional guidance is needed
and expected in order to determine&nbsp;the impact, but we do not expect any impact to be material. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">h/
Revenue recognition </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As indicated in Note&nbsp;1o of the 2009 consolidated financial statements included in
the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F, revenue under IAS 18 accounting is measured at the fair value of the consideration received or to be received when the Group has transferred the significant risks and rewards of ownership of a product to the buyer.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For revenues and expenses generated from construction contracts, the Group applies the percentage of completion
method of accounting, provided certain specified conditions are met, based either on the achievement of contractually defined milestones or on costs incurred compared with total estimated costs. The determination of the stage of completion and the
revenues to be recognized rely on numerous estimations based on costs incurred and acquired experience. Adjustments of initial estimates can, however, occur throughout the life of the contract, which
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
can have significant impacts on future net income (loss). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Although estimates inherent in construction contracts are subject to uncertainty, certain situations exist whereby management is
unable to reliably estimate the outcome of a construction contract. These situations can occur during the early stages of a contract due to a lack of historical experience or throughout the contract as significant uncertainties develop related to
additional costs, claims and performance obligations, particularly with new technologies. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Contracts that are multiple
element arrangements can include hardware products, stand-alone software, installation and/or integration services, extended warranty, product roadmaps, as examples. Revenue for each unit of accounting is recognized when earned based on the relative
fair value of each unit of accounting as determined by internal or third-party analyses of market-based prices. If the criteria described in Note&nbsp;1o are met, revenue is earned when units of accounting are delivered. If such criteria are not
met, revenue for the arrangement as a whole is accounted for as a single unit of accounting. Significant judgment is required to allocate contract consideration to each unit of accounting and determine whether the arrangement is a single unit of
accounting or a multiple element arrangement. Depending upon how such judgment is exercised, the timing and amount of revenue recognized could differ significantly. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For multiple element arrangements that are based principally on licensing, selling or otherwise marketing software solutions,
judgment is required as to whether such arrangements are accounted for under IAS 18 or IAS 11. Software arrangements requiring significant production, modification or customization are accounted for as a construction contract under IAS 11. All other
software arrangements are accounted for under IAS 18, in which case the Group requires vendor specific objective evidence (VSOE) of fair value to separate the multiple software elements. If VSOE of fair value is not available, revenue is deferred
until the final element in the arrangement is delivered or revenue is recognized over the period that services are being performed if services are the last undelivered element. Significant judgment is required to determine the most appropriate
accounting model to be applied in this environment and whether VSOE of fair value exists to allow separation of multiple software elements. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>52</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">For product sales made through distributors, product returns that are estimated
according to contractual obligations and past sales statistics are recognized as a reduction of sales. Again, if the actual product returns were considerably different from those estimated, the resulting impact on the net income (loss) could be
significant. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">It can be difficult to evaluate the Group&#146;s capacity to recover receivables. Such evaluation is
based on the customers&#146; creditworthiness and on the Group&#146;s capacity to sell such receivables without recourse. If, subsequent to revenue recognition, the recoverability of a receivable that had been initially considered as likely becomes
doubtful, a provision for an impairment loss is then recorded (see Note&nbsp;2b above). </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">i/
Purchase price allocation of a business combination </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In a business combination, the acquirer must allocate
the cost of the business combination at the acquisition date by recognizing the acquiree&#146;s identifiable assets, liabilities and contingent liabilities at fair value at that date. The allocation is based upon certain valuations and other studies
performed with the assistance of outside valuation specialists. Due to the underlying assumptions made in the valuation process, the determination of those fair values requires estimations of the effects of uncertain future events at the acquisition
date and the carrying amounts of some assets, such as fixed assets, acquired through a business combination could therefore differ significantly in the future. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As prescribed by IFRS 3 (revised), if the initial accounting for a business combination can be determined only provisionally by
the end of the reporting period in which the combination is effected, the acquirer must account for the business combination using those provisional values and has a twelve-month period to complete the purchase price allocation. Any adjustment of
the carrying amount of an identifiable asset or liability made as a result of completing the initial accounting is accounted for as if its fair value at the acquisition date had been recognized from that date. Detailed adjustments accounted for in
the allocation period are disclosed in Note&nbsp;3. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Once the initial accounting of a business combination is complete, only errors may
be corrected. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">j/
Accounting treatment of convertible bonds with optional redemption periods/dates before contractual maturity </FONT></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Some of our convertible bonds have optional redemption periods/dates occurring before their contractual maturity. All the
Alcatel-Lucent convertible bond issues were accounted for in accordance with IAS 32 requirements (paragraphs 28 to 32) as described in Note&nbsp;1m to the 2009 consolidated financial statements included in the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F. Classification
of the liability and equity components of a convertible instrument is not revised when a change occurs in the likelihood that a conversion will be exercised. On the other hand, if optional redemption periods/dates occur before the contractual
maturity of a debenture, a change in the likelihood of redemption before the contractual maturity can lead to a change in the estimated payments. As prescribed by IAS 39, if an issuer revises the estimates of payment due to reliable new estimates,
it must adjust the carrying amount of the instrument by computing the present value of the remaining cash flows at the original effective interest rate of the financial liability to reflect the revised estimated cash flows. The adjustment is
recognized as income or expense in profit or loss. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">As described in Notes&nbsp;9, 17 and 19, such a change in
estimates occurred during the second quarter of 2009 regarding Lucent&#146;s 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debenture. Similar changes in estimates could occur in the future for all convertible debentures with optional redemption periods/dates. A
loss corresponding to the difference between the present value of the revised estimated cash flows and the carrying amount derived from the split accounting, as described in Note&nbsp;1m to the 2009 consolidated financial statements included in the
Group&#146;s 2009 20-F, could impact &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; as a result of any change in the Group&#146;s estimate of redemption triggers on all of Lucent&#146;s convertible debt. An approximation of the potential negative impact
on &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; is the carrying amount of the equity component, as disclosed in Notes 17 and 19. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>53</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Because of the new accounting treatment described above, the carrying amount of the
Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debentures was equal to the nominal value of the debentures just before the first optional redemption date (i.e. June&nbsp;15, 2010). Some of the holders of the Series A convertible debentures did not request
redemptions as of June&nbsp;15, 2010. At June&nbsp;30, 2010, and as described in Notes&nbsp;9, 17 and 19, we did not consider it possible to estimate reliably the future cash flows and the expected life of the remaining outstanding debentures,
because the next optional redemption date (i.e. June&nbsp;15, 2015) is too far in the future. Thus, and as prescribed by IAS 39, we reapplied the initial accounting treatment and adjusted the carrying amount of the outstanding Series A convertible
debentures using their contractual cash flows up to their contractual maturity date (i.e. June&nbsp;15, 2023). A profit corresponding to the difference between the outstanding nominal value and the present value of the cash flows up to the
contractual maturity date was recognized in &#147;Other financial income (loss)&#148;. Further changes in estimates in respect of the Series A convertible debentures may occur in the future, in which case the carrying amount of the debentures could
be further adjusted. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">k/
Insured damages </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In 2008, Alcatel-Lucent experienced a fire in a newly-built factory containing new
machinery. Non-recoverable assets having a net book value of
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;4&nbsp;million were written off as of
September&nbsp;30, 2008, representing an equivalent negative impact on cost of sales in 2008. The cost of the physical damage and business interruption were insured and gave right to an indemnity claim, the amount of which was definitively settled
as of September&nbsp;30, 2009. Alcatel-Lucent received <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;33&nbsp;million on its business interruption
insurance, which was accounted for in other revenues during 2009, when the cash was received. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In December&nbsp;2009,
the roof and technical floor of Alcatel-Lucent Spain&#146;s headquarters in Madrid partially collapsed for unknown reasons. Alcatel-Lucent Spain rents this building and the lease is accounted for as an operating lease. The damaged assets were
derecognized as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 with a negative impact of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million on income (loss)
from operating activities. All costs related to this incident (damaged assets, displacement and relocation costs, etc.) are insured subject to a
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;15&nbsp;million deductible. Displacement and relocation costs below this threshold will be
accounted for as incurred in 2010. These costs represented a negative impact of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;1&nbsp;million on
income (loss) from operating activities during the first six months of 2010. As the cause of the incident is still not known, nothing has been reserved related to Alcatel-Lucent Spain&#146;s potential liability to third parties. At this stage,
Alcatel-Lucent Spain&#146;s liability is not considered probable. However, depending upon the results of the investigation, this situation could evolve. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">N<SMALL>OTE
</SMALL> 3. C<SMALL>HANGES</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>CONSOLIDATED</SMALL> <SMALL>COMPANIES</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">No material change in consolidated companies occurred during the first six months
of 2010. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The main changes in consolidated companies for 2009 were as follows: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">On November&nbsp;23, 2009, Alcatel-Lucent announced an agreement to sell its electrical fractional horsepower motors and drives activities,
Dunkermotoren GmbH, to Triton, a leading European private equity firm, for an enterprise value of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;145&nbsp;million. The sale was completed on December&nbsp;31, 2009 and the preliminary cash
proceeds received was <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;128&nbsp;million. The 2009 net capital gain of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;99&nbsp;million is presented in the line item
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TD WIDTH="37" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
&#147;Gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities&#148; in the income statement. This amount was subject to a purchase price adjustment that occurred in the first six months of 2010 for an
amount of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;(3)&nbsp;million; </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">on April&nbsp;30, 2009, Bharti Airtel and Alcatel-Lucent announced the formation of a joint venture to manage Bharti Airtel&#146;s pan-India
broadband and telephone services and help Airtel&#146;s transition to next generation network across India. A new legal entity was formed which was fully consolidated by Alcatel-Lucent from September&nbsp;30, 2009 onwards;

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>54</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&nbsp;&nbsp;
&nbsp;&nbsp;Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report 2010 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">the sale of our 20.8&nbsp;% stake in Thales was completed during the second quarter of 2009 with a capital gain of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;255&nbsp;million accounted for in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148;. This capital gain
takes into account <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;191&nbsp;million corresponding to the remaining part of the capital gain that
was accounted for in connection with the contribution of our railway signaling business and our integration and services activities for mission-critical systems sold in 2007, and which was eliminated as an intra-group transaction; and
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">the purchase price of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;670&nbsp;million paid to the Group by Thales for the disposal of the space business completed in
2007 was subject to adjustment in 2009. As a result, Thales was required to pay to the Group an additional
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;130&nbsp;million (before fees), which was accounted for in &#147;income from discontinued
operations&#148; and cashed in for an amount of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;118&nbsp;million during the second quarter of 2009.
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> </DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">N<SMALL>OTE
</SMALL> 4. C<SMALL>HANGE</SMALL> <SMALL>IN</SMALL> <SMALL>ACCOUNTING</SMALL> <SMALL>POLICY</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>PRESENTATION</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Since the Group&#146;s adoption of IFRSs in 2004 for construction contracts, costs
incurred to date plus recognized profits less the sum of recognized losses (in the case of provisions for contract losses) and progress billings were determined quarterly on a contract-by-contract basis. If the amount was positive, it was included
in the statement of financial position as an asset under &#147;amount due from customers on construction contracts&#148;. If the amount was negative, it was included as a liability under &#147;amount due to customers on construction contracts&#148;.
This presentation was based on our understanding of the requirements of IAS 11. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In practice, however, disclosure of
these amounts in the statement of financial position is not common. Instead, the information is commonly disclosed in the notes to the financial statements.
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
For this reason, the Group has decided to stop presenting in the statement of financial position the asset and liability for amounts due from, and amounts due to, customers on construction
contracts, respectively. Instead, the information will be disclosed as a Note&nbsp;in our annual consolidated financial statements. Inventories and work in progress-net, trade receivables and other receivables-net, product sales reserves and,
occasionally, customers&#146; deposits and advances are items in the statement of financial position that will be impacted by the new presentation. Notes 16 and 18 to these financial statements show how the amounts due to/due from customers on
construction contracts as of December&nbsp;31, 2009 have been reclassified to the aforesaid captions, to be comparable with the new presentation at June&nbsp;30, 2010. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">N<SMALL>OTE
</SMALL> 5. I<SMALL>NFORMATION</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL> <SMALL>OPERATING</SMALL> <SMALL>SEGMENT</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>BY</SMALL> <SMALL>GEOGRAPHICAL</SMALL> <SMALL>SEGMENT</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">In accordance with IFRS 8 &#147;Operating Segments&#148;, the information by
operating segment comes from the business organization and activities of Alcatel-Lucent. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Starting in 2010, we no
longer organize our business according to four operating segments (also called business segments) - Carrier,
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
Applications Software, Enterprise and Services. As of January&nbsp;1, 2010, the Group is organized in three operating segments. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The tables below present information for the operating segments described hereunder. They take into account the new organization
effective January&nbsp;1, 2010. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>55</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>

<DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The information reported for each of our three operating segments is the same as
that presented to the Chief Operating Decision Maker (i.e. the Chief Executive Officer) and is used to make decisions on resource allocation and to assess performance. As of January&nbsp;1, 2010, the three operating segments are: </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><B><I>Networks</I></B>: this segment, which is essentially the same as the former Carrier segment, is streamlined to encompass five product
divisions: IP, Optics, Wireless networks, Wireline networks and Radio Frequency Systems (RFS); </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><B><I>applications:</I></B> develops and maintains software products for our applications business. It consists of the Applications Software
segment that was in place in 2009 and the enterprise voice telephony and data networking businesses that were part of the Enterprise segment in 2009. The enterprise voice and data businesses are increasingly focused on software-based platforms, as
is the case with applications, and also share an increasingly common enterprise customer base with our applications business; and </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="18" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#7f6bba">&#149;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"><B><I>services</I></B>: this segment, which is substantially the same as the former Services segment, is composed of four product divisions:
Managed&nbsp;&amp; outsourcing solutions, Product attached services, Multivendor maintenance, and Network and system integration. It no longer includes OSS/BSS (operations support systems/business support systems) software
</FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
</DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="37" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="1"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
activities that are now part of the Applications Software segment. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The former Enterprise segment no longer exists as a separate segment. Its voice and data businesses have been moved to
Applications, as noted above, while a portion of its Industrial Components business (electrical fractional horsepower motors and drives activities) was sold to Triton in 2009 (refer to Note&nbsp;3) and the remaining Industrial Components business is
now included in a segment that we call &#147;Other&#148;. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Segment information for the prior periods has been
re-presented to conform to the current period presentation, to reflect the new organization effective January&nbsp;1, 2010. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The information by operating segment follows the same accounting policies as those used and described in these condensed interim
consolidated financial statements. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">All inter-segment commercial relations are conducted on an arm&#146;s length basis
on terms and conditions identical to those prevailing for the supply of goods and services to third parties. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">The
business model also comprises three customer-facing regions, Americas; Europe, Middle East and Africa (EMEA); and Asia Pacific (APAC). The regions&#146; primary mission is to sell and ensure the highest customer satisfaction. The three regions each
have complete responsibility for all customer-focused activities except for the Enterprise and strategic markets. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">a/
Information by operating segment </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="48%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD></TD>

<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="4%"></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9">&nbsp;<FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</SMALL> 6. R<SMALL>EVENUES</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:24px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</SMALL> 8. S<SMALL>HARE</SMALL>-<SMALL>BASED</SMALL> <SMALL>PAYMENTS</SMALL> (<SMALL>STOCK</SMALL> <SMALL>OPTION</SMALL> <SMALL>PLANS</SMALL>) </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Impact on income
(loss) from operating activities of share-based payments resulting from stock options, stock purchase plans and restricted stocks units and restricted cash units </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:3%"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Compensation expense recognized for share-based payments in accordance with IFRS 2 is analyzed as follows: </FONT></P>

costs</FONT></I></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">6</FONT></I>
</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">9</FONT></I>
</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">- restructuring
costs</FONT></I></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Of which equity settled

<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD VALIGN="top" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Of which cash
settled<SUP STYLE="vertical-align:baseline; position:relative; bottom:.8ex">&nbsp;(1)</SUP></FONT></I></FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1px solid #5f46a9"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1"><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">0</FONT></I>

</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:4px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(1)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">French taxes paid at the grant date by Alcatel-Lucent for stock options, restricted stock units and performance shares granted from January&nbsp;1, 2008 onwards.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Only share-based payment plans established after November&nbsp;7, 2002, and whose
share-based payments were not yet fully vested at January&nbsp;1, 2005, are restated according to IFRS 2 &#147;Share-based Payment&#148;. Those share-based payments that were fully vested at December&nbsp;31, 2004 did not result in a charge due to
the adoption of IFRSs in subsequent accounting periods. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">By simplification, for historical Alcatel plans, during the
vesting period and as a result of employees leaving the Group, no share-based payment forfeitures are taken into account when determining compensation expense for share-based payment granted. During the vesting period and as a result of employees
leaving the Group, the accounting impact of share-based payment forfeiture is recognized when the forfeiture is made. For share-based payments cancelled by forfeiture before the end of the vesting period, this can mean correcting the charge,
recognized in prior accounting periods, in the period following the forfeiture. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">During the vesting period, estimated
annual forfeiture rates of 7&nbsp;% for Lucent plans and 5&nbsp;% for share-based payments granted by Alcatel-Lucent since March&nbsp;2007 are applied when determining compensation expense. The estimated forfeiture rate is ultimately adjusted to
actual. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Share-based payments cancelled after the vesting period and share-based payments not
</FONT></P></DIV><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:right; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">
exercised do not result in correcting charges previously recognized. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Information (characteristics, fair values, assumptions and numbers) regarding all stock options and performance shares granted
before December&nbsp;31, 2009 are given in Note&nbsp;23e of the 2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20F. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">At a meeting on March&nbsp;17, 2010, the Board of Directors authorized the grant of 18,734,266 stock options and a maximum of
7,314,502 performance shares. Using a 45&nbsp;% expected volatility, a 3&nbsp;% risk free rate and a 0.8&nbsp;% distribution rate on future income, the fair value of one stock option is
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;0.95 and the fair value of one performance share is
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;2.40. Vesting conditions and availability for stock-options are the same as for stock-options
granted during 2009 excluding the March&nbsp;2009 all employees plan as described in Note&nbsp;23e of the 2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F. Regarding performance shares authorized for granting on
March&nbsp;17, 2010, vesting conditions and availability are the same as the performance shares granted in the past, as described in Note&nbsp;23e of the 2009 consolidated financial statements filed as part of the Group&#146;s 2009 20-F, except the
performance condition, which is based on one criterion instead of several criteria. </FONT></P></DIV><br clear="All">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report

in respect of the outstanding Lucent 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debentures (see Note&nbsp;19). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">2009: of which a gain of <FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">
</FONT>&nbsp;50&nbsp;million in the first quarter of 2009 related to the partial repurchase of Lucent&#146;s 7.75&nbsp;% bonds due March&nbsp;2017 (see Note&nbsp;19). In the second quarter 2009, a loss of
<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;175&nbsp;million related to a change of estimated future cash flows related to Lucent&#146;s
2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debentures (see Note&nbsp;19). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">N<SMALL>OTE
</SMALL> 10. D<SMALL>ISCONTINUED</SMALL> <SMALL>OPERATIONS</SMALL>, <SMALL>ASSETS</SMALL> <SMALL>HELD</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>SALE</SMALL> <SMALL>AND</SMALL> <SMALL>LIABILITIES</SMALL> <SMALL>RELATED</SMALL> <SMALL>TO</SMALL>
<SMALL>DISPOSAL</SMALL> <SMALL>GROUPS</SMALL> <SMALL>HELD</SMALL> <SMALL>FOR</SMALL> <SMALL>SALE</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV STYLE="position:relative;float:left; margin-right:1%; width:48%;padding-right:9px;padding-bottom:8px;overflow:hidden">
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:19px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="2" COLOR="#333333">Discontinued operations for 2009 and the first six months of 2010 are as follows:

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(3)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">Reversal of deferred tax liabilities related to Lucent&#146;s 2.875&nbsp;% Series A convertible debentures. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(4)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">The six month period ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 impact is mainly due to the re-assessment of the recoverability of the deferred tax assets in connection with the
2010 annual impairment test of goodwill performed in the second quarter of 2010. 2009 impacts are mainly due to the re-assessment of the recoverability of deferred tax assets recognized in connection with the annual impairment test of goodwill
performed in the second quarter of 2009. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Alcatel-Lucent First Half Report
2010&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#5f46a9"><B>61</B></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">(5)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">The six month period ended June&nbsp;30, 2010 impact is mainly due to consequences of the recent Healthcare laws enacted in the U.S. These laws have one
significant provision that impacted the Group involving the Medicare Part D tax free subsidy of about US$&nbsp;34&nbsp;million annually that we receive from the Government for continuing to provide our prescription drug benefit to Medicare-eligible
active represented employees and formerly represented retirees. This legislation eliminates the deduction for expense allocable to the subsidy beginning in 2013 resulting in a reduction in our deferred tax asset and, a corresponding income statement
charge of about US$&nbsp;101&nbsp;million (<FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333">&#128;</FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:ARIAL" SIZE="1" COLOR="#333333"></FONT>&nbsp;76&nbsp;million) in the first six months of 2010 that
includes the enactment date. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5"><B><I><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="5" COLOR="#333333">N<SMALL>OTE
</SMALL> 12. E<SMALL>ARNINGS</SMALL> <SMALL>PER</SMALL> <SMALL>SHARE</SMALL> </FONT></I></B></FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333"></FONT><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3"><B><FONT STYLE="font-family:Times New Roman" SIZE="3" COLOR="#333333">a/ Number
of shares comprising the capital stock </FONT></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
